Title: Govt declares film Thappad SGST-free for social message
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Indore: Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday exempted state goods and service tax for three months on upcoming Taapasee Pannu-starrer film ‘ Thappad ’. The film delves in effects of domestic violence.

Commercial tax department issued a circular, asking single-screen cinemas and multiplexes to refrain from collecting SGST on tickets of the film directed by Anubhav Sinha scheduled to be released on February 28. The tax will be exempted till May 27.

At present, film tickets carry 18 percent GST -- SGST and central goods and services tax at nine per cen each.

Pannu has played the character of Amrita, an upper-middle class woman, who objects to domestic violence at early stage of her marriage and files for a divorce after she was slapped by her husband at a party. In January, the government had declared ‘Chhapaak’ featuring Deepika Padukone as tax free.

Title: Cong, BJP protest against reservation, loan waiver scheme
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Nashik: The city units of the Congress and BJP on Tuesday staged dharnas in front of the district collectorate on different issues.

The Congress camp staged a protest against the alleged conspiracy by BJP to do away with reservations for SCs, STs and other backward classes. The party functionaries submitted a memorandum to the district authorities demanding that the BJP-led government at the Centre and different states continue with the reservation policy.

“The BJP government in Uttarakhand recently argued before the Supreme Court that reservations were not a fundamental right as per the Constitution. This led the apex court to give a verdict which could have a negative fallout of reservation rights of the deprived sections of society,” stated the Congress memorandum.

The Congress leaders alleged that when the issue was raised in the parliament the ruling-party misled the house on the issue. The party reminded BJP that it was imperative to continue with the reservation policy to ameliorate the plight of the oppressed class of the society.

On the other hand, BJP organised the agitation alleging that the present Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government has failed to fulfill its promises to the farmers.

The party also submitted a memorandum to the district authorities on the issue. “The loan waiver scheme announced by the MVA government for farmers is not adequate. The government when it came to power had announced a total waiver of loans for all farmers. But the scheme that was announced will not solve the woes of the farmers,” alleged the BJP leader accusing Shiv Sena of deceiving BJP to form a government with Congress and NCP.

According to the BJP leaders, the MVA government has failed to fulfill the promises to the people of the state after it came to power.

Title: Several TRS leaders line up for RS berth
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Hyderabad: The Election Commission on Tuesday released an election schedule to fill Rajya Sabha seat vacancies across the country, including two in Telangana. Two MPs — KVP Ramachandra Rao and Garikapati Mohan Rao — are retiring in April.

The ruling TRS is likely to secure both the seats as the opposition parties do not have enough numbers. TRS secretary general K Keshava Rao is also retiring in April, but as a member of Andhra Pradesh since he was allotted to AP during bifurcation of the state.

TRS sources said party president K Chandrasekhar Rao will take a call on the candidates in the first week of March after Pattana Pragathi programme concludes on March 4.

While over a dozen leaders are vying for the MP seats, sources said one candidate who would go to the Upper House will be either former Nizamabad MP Kalvakuntla Kavitha or planning board vice-chairman B Vinod Kumar.

Presently, TRS has six MPs in the elders’ House. Though D Srinivas is still technically with TRS, he does not enjoy good relations with the party leadership.

A notification for the elections will be issued on March 6 and last date for receiving nominations is March 13. While polling will be held on March 26 between 9 am and 4 pm, counting will be taken up on the same day at 5 pm.

Title: Onus on petitioner to give admissible legacy proof: High court
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative Image

Title: Cabinet nod to police, forensic and Ayush universities in Uttar Pradesh
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

UP CM Yogi Adityanath

LUCKNOW: The state cabinet on Tuesday gave its go ahead to a UP Police and Forensic University in Lucknow. The UP Police and Forensic Science University Bill (2020) will be tabled in both houses.

A senior government official said, “The need for such university was felt as existing forensic laboratories were not sufficient and pendency was growing.” “UP has 75 districts but only five laboratories in Lucknow, Agra, Varanasi, Ghaziabad and Moradabad. The government is setting up six laboratories in Allahabad, Gorakhpur, Kannauj, Aligarh, Gonda and Jhansi,” said government spokesman.

In a major relief to business community, the cabinet also cleared the proposal to waive off penalties and interest under UP Sales Tax Act (1948), Central Sales Tax Act (1956), Entertainment Tax Act (1979), UP Entry Tax Act (2007), VAT and UP Cable Television Network Rules of 1997. All penalties till March 31, 2019 have been waived off.

The cabinet also approved changing the name of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti Urdu, Arbi-Farsi University, as suggested by governor Anandiben Patel, to Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti Bhasha University.

In a relief to builders, changes have also been made to floor area ratio (FAR) in Noida. The new FAR has been fixed at 0.60 for both residential and commercial constructions, giving builders additional 27% area.

The cabinet also cleared the proposal of setting up an Ayush University in Gorakhpur.

The cabinet has cleared Rs 15,722 crore for providing piped water to seven districts in Bundelkhand and two in Vindhya region which are affected by arsenic and fluoride and where diseases like JE and AES are common. Detailed project reports (DPRs) of 545 projects have already been prepared.

Title: Maharashtra rolls out student police cadet programme
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

AURANGABAD: The home department has released Rs 3.25 crore for 650 schools in the state for the implementation of student police cadet programme (SPCP), which aims to teach students community policing, road safety, anti-corruption measures.

The programme is a part of the modernization of police force and students from Classes VIII and IX are selected. The nationwide project launched in July 2018 is a school-based youth development initiative that trains high school students to evolve as future leaders of a democratic society by inculcating within them respect for the law, discipline, civic sense, empathy for vulnerable sections of society and resistance to social evils.

The government notification states that Rs 50,000 is being allotted to each of the shortlisted schools for outdoor activities, training and contingency expenditure. The respective unit commanders, heading districts as well as commissionorate areas will be responsible for the disbursement of the funds.

A senior police officer privy to the implementation of the programme in the state said that under the first section, topics including community policing, road safety, fight against social evils, safety of women and children, fight against corruption, disaster management are covered.

Title: MJP University exams: Slow internet hits live monitoring of 40% centres
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Bareilly: Live monitoring of the final exams of the colleges affiliated to Mahatma Jyotiba Phule (MJP) Rohilkhand University was affected on the very first day, on Tuesday, said sources here. They said slow speed of internet hindered monitoring through webcasting of nearly 40% of the exam centres at these colleges in the second shift.

The annual exams are being conducted in a total of 322 exam centres across nine districts of Bareilly and Moradabad divisions. The exams are being conducted in three shifts -- 7 am to 10 am, 11 am to 2 pm and 3 pm to 6 pm. To monitor live proceedings at these exam centres and to keep a check on use of unfair means, two control rooms have been set up in Bareilly -- on the campus of MJP Rohilkhand University and regional higher education office, respectively. The monitoring has to be done from 6.45 am to 8 pm.

However, officials said the monitoring of around 40% of centres was affected, when the internet speed slowed down in the second shift. However, after the staff deployed at the control room asked the incharge of these exam centres to improve internet connectivity for better monitoring, the internet speed increased in the third shift, said officials.

Regional higher education officer Rajesh Prakash said, “It has come to the fore that a few exam centres in Bareilly, Budaun and Moradabad did not share their IP address with us for monitoring the exam proceedings through webcasting. We have issued a warning to these centres and have decided to deploy an observer here to check use of unfair means during the exams.”

He added, “After it came to my notice that invigilators at a few centres were not carrying identity cards, which is against the guidelines, we have issued a warning to them.”

Exam controller Sanjeev Kumar said, “We will ask incharge of the exam centres to ensure proper internet speed throughout the exam time. Besides, no case of use of unfair means during the exams was reported.”

A total of 4.57 lakh students have been registered for appearing in the final exams of MJP Rohilkhand University. Of the total 4.57 lakh, 3.33 lakh are regular students while 1.23 lakh are private students. Besides, five teams of flying squads have been constituted.

Title: Dehradun: Ruckus at Doon hospital
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative Image

DEHRADUN: Alleging medical negligence , the family of a pregnant woman created ruckus at Doon hospital on Tuesday evening. The hospital administration called police after the family members manhandled hospital staff.

Talking to TOI, Dr Ashutosh Sayana, principal of Doon hospital said that the kin of the patient were already informed about the complications in the pregnancy.

“The baby had died in the womb before delivery but they still manhandled our staff. Though we have informed police, we are still treating the woman,” he said.

Title: CU to meet UGC to ensure validity of courses offered in Lakshadweep
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kozhikode: A delegation from the University of Calicut (CU) along with its officials from Lakshadweep will hold talks with the University Grants Commission (UGC) to ensure that the validity of certificates issued by the varsity to the students studying at three CU centres in the Union territory is not affected by the UGC rules regarding territorial jurisdiction of varsities.

The decision was taken at a meeting held by CU officials with its Lakshwadeep administration and MP Mohammad Faizal PP over the last two days.

Varsity registrar C L Joshy, who was also part of the delegation that held the meeting in Lakshwadeep said CU has been the main higher education provider of Lakshadweep for the last four decades and the islands have been the operational area of the varsity for all practical purposes. However, the varsity has not been formally included in the Lakshadweep islands under its geographical jurisdiction.

As per UGC policy, a university established or incorporated by or under a State Act shall operate only within the territorial jurisdiction allotted to it under its act and in no case beyond the territory of the state of its location. The Lakshadweep administration had recently written to the varsity about the UGC approval of the courses being conducted at the Calicut University centres in Lakshadweep over possible jurisdictional issues.

“We decided that a delegation from the varsity along with the MP of Lakshadweep would meet the UGC next month to apprise them that the varsity has been operating in the Union territory for the last four decades as its main higher education provider. Though there is no reason for concern at the moment, we want to make sure that the jurisdictional issues don’t pose any threat and want to establish that the islands have been part of the operational area of the varsity,” he added.

The Lakshwadeep officials also raised concern about low pass percentage in PG courses offered by the varsity centres but for MSc Aqua Culture. Varsity officials said they would rethink on whether to continue post graduate courses like MSc Mathematics, MA Arabic and MCom which have been witnessing low pass percentage. “We are planning to do a rethink on whether to continue the courses with low pass percentage from next year,” Joshy added. Also, the varsity authorities told the Lakshadweep officials that they would consider introducing integrated four-year B Ed courses.

The varsity delegation also comprised syndicate members K K Haneefa and Tom K Thomas.

Calicut university has been running three centres in Lakshadweep, located at the islands of Andrott, Kadamat and College of Education situated at Kavaratti where around 1,000 students are studying.

Title: Ahmedabad: After sharp rise, gold prices fall to Rs 44,100
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

AHMEDABAD: After a sharp rise in gold prices that breached the Rs 45,000-mark on Monday, touching a new record high, the yellow metal prices fell once again on Tuesday. Pure gold price settled at Rs 44,100 per 10 gram on Tuesday in the Ahmedabad market, sliding by Rs 950 in just a day. Analysts said that gold prices declined in the international market, because of which they plunged in the local markets as well.

“Safe haven investments by global investors went up in the past few days, amid growing worries over coronavirus outbreak in other countries, due to which gold prices went up in the international markets, as they opened on Monday. However, owing to profit-booking by investors, prices showed a decline a day later on Tuesday,” said Haresh Acharya, director, India Bullion and Jewellers’ Association (IBJA).

Due to rising gold prices, the demand for physical gold has shown a sharp decline in the local markets, said bullion traders as well as jewellers.

“The market is in the worst possible condition at this point and even the ongoing wedding season has failed to revive demand for physical gold. High prices are hurting the customers and impacting purchases. The wedding season will soon be done with and it will further hit demand severely if prices remain at the same point,” said a city-based bullion trader.

Title: 23 roads in Aurangabad to be constructed by three agencies
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Government sanctioned Rs 152.24 crore for the construction of 23 roads in Aurangabad

AURANGABAD: The state government has sanctioned Rs 152.24 crore for the construction of 23 roads in the city and stated that instead of putting the onus only on one entity, the responsibility of constructing roads is to be shouldered by the MIDC, the MSRDC and the civic administration.

Of the 23 roads approved for construction, the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC) has taken up construction of seven roads — the list of which was published on Tuesday — Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) will construct nine roads and Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation (MSRDC) will be working on seven roads and a bridge.

The MIDC has floated a tender worth Rs 41 crore for the construction of the roads. AMC issued a tender on Monday. Altogether, the three agenies have floated tenders worth Rs 135 crore.

The MIDC will take up construction of roads in Connaught Place, the stretch from MGM-Raj Heights to Cidco N-5 ESR, API Corner to Kalagram via Prozone Mall, and API corner to N-1 Police Chowki via Cidco bus stand. MIDC will carry out widening of the stretch from Sai Medicity Hospital to survey number 153 Harsul, Cidco N-3 Sai Transport to Shivnath Rathi’s residence in Cidco N-4 via Shiv Chhatrapati College, Greaves Cotton to Jai Bhawani Chowk to Naregaon via Anil Chemical, and Piya Market to City Chowk via Surana Building road.

The AMC will lay bitumen on the stretch from Wockhardt to Jai Bhawani Chowk-Naregaon, railway station to Tirupati Enclave, Jalgaon Road to Hotel Ajanta Ambassador, Agrasen Chowk to central excise office and Hotel Amarpreet to Ekta Chowk . The concretisation of roads from Hotel Dipali to Jai Bhawani Nagar chowk and Mukundwadi railway station, Pundalik Nagar water tank to Cidco N-3 Kamgar Chowk, Bhawani petrol pump in Cidco N-2 to C Sector Thackeray Nagar, Mahalaxmi Chowk to Lokshahi colony and bitumen layering of the railway station flyover will also be done by the civic body.

Title: HC stays demolition in Jauhar University
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Allahabad: The Allahabad high court on Tuesday stayed the demolition of construction on disputed plots in Mohammad Ali Jauhar University, Rampur till March 31.

Disposing of the petition filed by Maulana Mohammand Ali Jauhar Trust, Rampur, Justice Salil Kumar Rai observed, “As the time for filing revision against the order dated February 20, 2020 passed by assistant collector has not expired yet, and the constructions existing on the disputed plots are of an educational institution, hence in the interest of justice, it is directed that the construction existing on the disputed plots shall not be demolished till March 31, 2020.” The government counsel had earlier raised an objection on the petition stating that the petitioner has the remedy of filing for revision of the order of Assistant Collector of Rampur dated February 22, 2020, before SDM and hence a petition is not maintainable.

Title: Forgery case: Azam Khan, wife, son declared ‘absconders’, properties to be confiscated
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan along with his wife and son appear before a team of SIT (File Photo)

RAMPUR: A day after rejecting anticipatory bail pleas of Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan , wife Tanzeen Fatimah and son Abdullah Azam , who are both MLAs, and declaring them “absconders”, a local court on Tuesday ordered “confiscation of their moveable and immovable properties” in connection with a forgery case.

The accused have been chargesheeted under various sections of IPC for allegedly helping their son obtain two fake birth certificates.

In a separate case related to an alleged encroachment over enemy property by Azam Khan, additional district and sessions judge Dhirendra Kumar Kamboj had granted anticipatory bail to Azam on Monday but ordered him to surrender his passport to police and seek court’s prior permission before embarking on a foreign trip.

In September 2019, the court had issued summons to all three lawmakers, after taking cognisance of the chargesheet filed by Rampur police, in which all three have been charged with forgery and cheating. The court had directed the SHO of Ganj Kotwali police station, under whose jurisdiction the family resides, to ensure compliance of its order.

Thereafter, the court had issued non-bailable warrants against the Khans after they had failed to present themselves before it.

After the prosecution claimed that the accused were clandestinely shifting valuables from their house, on the directions of the court, police carried out an inquiry and found the charges to be true.

Following this, the court invoked section 82 of CrPC to proclaim them “absconders”. The court directed the police to comply with the proclamation notice against Azam Khan and others into the matter.

The accused have been chargesheeted under sections 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 467 (forgery of valuable security, will), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating) and 471 (using as genuine a forged document) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

On January 3, 2019, local BJP leader Akash Saxena had lodged a complaint alleging that Azam and his wife helped their son in obtaining two fake birth certificates – one from Lucknow and another from Rampur – following which an FIR was registered at Ganj Kotwali.

Additional district government counsel Ram Avtar Saini said, “The court rejected the anticipatory bail applications of Azam Khan, his wife and son in three separate cases related to Abdullah's date of birth certificates, PAN cards and passport.”

Title: Delhi sends jitters to UP, leaves of all cops cancelled, flag marches in sensitive cities
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Bareilly/Agra/Meerut: Leaves of all policemen were cancelled and flag march was carried out in several sensitive cities of Uttar Pradesh as the state government tried to pre-empt any attempt to disturb peace after parts of neighbouring Delhi erupted in violence leaving at least 11 dead.

Aligarh, which witnessed clashes on Sunday leaving at least 10 injured, was virtually turned into a fortress with the deployment of 13 companies of RAF and PAC. In Meerut zone’s Hapur district, the administration invoked section 144 of Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC), barring assembly of five or more persons.

In Bareilly, additional director general of police (ADG) Avinash Chandra went a step further and warned of use of force against unauthorised protests. “I will not let the mistake of Delhi be repeated in the UP,” the police officer warned.

Sachindra Patel, superintendent of police (SP) of Firozabad, conducted a flag march with heavy police force in sensitive parts of the district.

“After violence in the national capital, we are on high alert. The district is divided into several zones and sectors. We are carrying out flag march in sensitive parts to send a message to locals that, at no cost, peace will be allowed to be compromised. Police presence is clear warning to anti-social elements,” SP Patel said.

Police are also keeping a close eye on social media platforms. Cyber cells of every district are scanning social media sites like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and WhatsApp groups.

“Any post which can trigger violence will be removed immediately and action will be taken against person sharing provocative content,” added SP Firozabad.

In December last year, at least seven residents of Firozabad were killed in violence which occurred during anti-CAA protest. Most of the victims died of bullet wounds. Police maintained that not a single bullet was fired by them.

Like Firozabad, flag marches by the security personnel were carried out in Bulandshahr, Sambhal and Baghpat also.

IG of Agra range, Satish Ganesh, who was on leave after overseeing security during US President Donal Trump’s visit to city, was asked to join immediately. ADG of Agra zone, Ajay Anand said, “DGP has asked everyone to remain alert at highest level.”

ADG of Bareilly zone, Chandra held a meeting with senior policemen. During the meeting, he said, “Any protest without permission will be dealt with immediate baton-charge. Rubber bullets and tear gas could be used if required.”

The ADG further said that he won’t let “mistake like Delhi to be repeated in the state and anybody trying to stage protest inside a police station will straightaway be charged by police.”

Chandra told TOI, “I would like send a message to the protesters. Irrespective of their religion, there will be zero tolerance for unapproved protests and especially people entering the police station for staging protest like Delhi. Police will welcome them with batons.”

After intelligence inputs from security agencies, home department has instructed ADGP-rank officials to stay in sensitive area like Rampur, Moradabad, Bijnor and Sambhal and keep a close eye on law and order situation. According to sources, UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath is monitoring the situation and is in continuous contact with the ADGP-ranked officials across the state.

Title: On last legs at land’s end
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Chennai: Dhanushkodi is no longer a ‘ghost town’, almost entirely wiped out by the super-cyclone of December 1964. Overrun by tourists with little knowledge of its heritage status, the abandoned settlement is hurtling towards collapse. Mainly due to apathy of a government that has allowed shops to be set up next to the fragile structures.

While the vestiges of a majestic church, a temple, a railway station, a post office and some cocoon-shaped storm shelters tell the sombre story of the tragedy that struck 55 years ago, thatched huts selling shells, trinkets and fish fry spilling over from the road onto the sands speak of neglect. The eroded train tracks jutting out of the sand, are covered with wild vegetation and trash.

The slapdash conservation of the ruins of Dhanushkodi, devastated by giant tidal waves on the intervening night of December 22 and 23, 1964, will dispel all doubts about the government’s lack of sense of tragedy and contemporary relevance of historic events. Post the 1964 tragedy, the 5km stretch from Mukuntharayar Chathiram near Rameswaram to Dhanushkodi was declared unfit for human habitation. Now, barring 200 households, descendants of earliest settlers, no one is allowed to live there. Arichamunai (‘eroded tip’) is another 4.5km away, the farthest one can go on foot.

It was only in 2017 after a new road was laid by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) that accessing Dhanushkodi became easier. Now any vehicle can reach Arichamunai. The number of visitors eager to visit the ruins of Dhanushkodi and the tip of Arichamunai has increased exponentially in the past couple of years. But the lack of preservation efforts and vision to explore the heritage potential of the area has led to further decay.

A ramshackle board, put up by the Dhanushkodi-Ram Sethu Tourist, Vendors’ Welfare Association, cautions visitors against damaging the church wall. Let alone insulating the ruins from the elements, there are no public convenience facilities and the area has turned into an open urinal and dump yard for plastic and food waste. It is as if the state is only waiting for the remains to crumble.

Tamil Nadu must immediately barricade the ruins to protect them from vandals, vendors and disruptive visitors. The adjacent stalls need to be cleared and given a dedicated stretch to carry on business. A route should be chalked out for tourists along a stretch that is a couple of kilometres long covering all the majestic ruins. A fitting way in which the structures can tell their story.

Title: Vigil in Wayanad as 9 test positive for monkey fever
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kozhikode: With nine persons testing positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease ( KFD ), commonly known as monkey fever , in Wayanad over the past two months, the Wayanad district administration has intensified the disease prevention and surveillance activities and has asked the people to maintain vigil.

District collector Dr Adeela Abdulla said that seven KFD cases were reported last year during the same period, including two deaths, and there have been nine positive cases this year. “We are asking people from tribal colonies and those living on forest fringes to maintain vigil. People have been advised to seek medical help if they have fever or other complications,” she said.

The district collector said a joint meeting of officials from the neighbouring district across the border in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu will be convened soon to strengthen preventive measures.

A control room has been opened to monitor the disease and help people with information and support (04936 204151, toll free 1077).

District medical officer Dr R Renuka said that disease surveillance and precautionary measures have been stepped up as the KFD season which normally coincides with the summer months could extend till May. She added that all the KFD cases reported this year has been from the Thirunelly panchayat which is surrounded by forests.

“All those venturing into forest for collection of minor forest produce, wood, etc, should get themselves vaccinated,” she said.

Title: Gujarat high court denies NRI custody of son despite Dallas court ruling
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Gujarat high court

AHMEDABAD: In a custody battle for a six-year-old son between an NRI couple, the Gujarat high court rejected the father’s habeas corpus petition seeking that he be handed over the child after taking his custody from the mother.

After returning from Dallas in US having obtained a divorce, the father is at present staying in Ahmedabad and the mother lives in Valsad with the boy. The father claimed before the HC that his wife was permitted to go to Australia for three months in 2017 with the child, but from Australia she applied for overseas citizenship of India for herself and son.

On the other hand, a court in Dallas, Texas, granted him the child’s custody while dissolving the marriage in July 2018, the father claimed. He has also filed a habeas corpus petition in the Dallas court for the child’s custody and the petition is pending.

The wife has also filed for the child’s custody in a Valsad court under the Guardians and Wards Act. She has also sued the husband under the Domestic Violence Act. Both applications are pending.

After hearing the petition, the high court denied the father custody saying that the custody with the mother cannot be termed illegal. The father’s habeas corpus petition was not maintainable because he had filed a similar petition in a foreign court. The HC further said that the father has got civil remedy to get custody of the child. The HC also noted that the habeas corpus petition was filed belatedly.

Besides, as the couple are Muslim, the HC said that according to Mohammedan law, the mother has a right to the child’s custody, if the child is male and below seven years of age.

The high court also took into consideration the allegation that the husband assaulted his wife and child in the USA at the instigation of a woman he was in an extramarital relationship with. “Now, taking into consideration this situation, we are satisfied that the child’s return may expose him to grave risk of harm. Therefore, it will be appropriate to refuse to issue directions to return the child to native state and more particularly in spite of a pre-existing order of the foreign court,” the HC said.

Title: Minister grants Haroon’s SSLC exam request
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: When Haroon Kareem T K , a blind Class X student of GVHSS Mankada in Malappuram, was writing his SSLC model exams last week, he was informed by school authorities that his application to write exams with the help of a computer was rejected by the director of general education (DGE). The district education officer of Malappuram received a directive that using a computer for SSLC exam is disallowed due to the lack of general guidelines.

Now, just weeks before his SSLC exam, education minister C Raveendranath has paved the way for Haroon to become the first blind student in Kerala to write the state board exam using a computer. Blind students use a combination of advanced software including screen readers and infty editor to listen to questions and answer them using a normal keyboard. Screen readers can then be used to check the answers.

Sources in the minister’s office said when the issue came up, Raveendranath took a proactive stand and approved the request. The GO will be released after a couple of days when DGE Jeevan Babu, who is in Dubai, returns. The delay is unlikely to affect Haroon as the first paper is a practical exam on computer applications on Saturday. Theory exams will begin on March 10, before which Haroon is expected to receive the GO.

Haroon, who was in Thiruvananthapuram to meet the minister and officials, said he was waiting for the special sanction when his friends were revising their lessons. “I have been using a computer to take notes and study for the past several years. It is difficult to communicate science and maths to scribes, who are junior students. For example, terms like sin in maths. I lost marks when the scribe misspelled Hindi words. I was hoping to write the exams using a computer when I learnt that I must choose a scribe or braille during my model exam (maths). That was the only model exam I fared badly,” said Haroon who usually scores 98% in maths.

Guidelines for conducting written exam for persons with benchmark disabilities 2018 states that such persons ‘will be given the option of choosing the mode of exam i.e. in braille or using a computer or in large print or even by recording the answers as examining bodies can easily make use of technology to convert question paper into e-large print, texts or braille’. Though other board exams made necessary changes to use assistive technologies, Kerala hadn’t taken a sensitive approach.

Ram Kamal Manoj, managing trustee of NGO Chakshumati that is engaged in the welfare of blind students, said SCERT often tries to discourage students from take the science stream.

“When students can use assistive technology independently, they are discouraged from using technology. Revised exam guidelines for persons with disabilities is still being processed at the office of DGE. Blind students shift to CBSE at the last minute to write exams using assistive technology. Haroon did not give up and now he is set to become the first students to write SSLC using computers,” he said.

Title: UP government begins probe against 5 mining officials for graft
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Yogi Adityanath

LUCKNOW: The Yogi Adityanath government on Tuesday initiated an inquiry against five mining officials, including one geologist, three assistant geologists and one mine inspector.

The three assistant geologist who will face inquiry are Adal Prasad, Arvind Kumar and Vijay Maurya, who were posted in Shamli, Kaushambi and Deoria respectively.

Likewise, geologist Moinuddin who was posted in Hamirpur and mine inspector Pankaj Singh who was posted in Deoria, will also be subjected to inquiry. Government sources said CBI had also registered an FIR against the five officials. The inquiry against the officials would be conducted by senior mining engineer Sudhir Dubey.

The five officials face charges of ignoring state government rules, allowing illegal mining and causing revenue loss to the state exchequer. The officials also face the charge of irregularities in renewing the licence of ‘patta’ (land lease).

The crackdown on mining officials comes in the backdrop of the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report, which has highlighted irregularities in the mining of minerals in the state in 2017-18, after BJP came to power in UP, as well during the previous SP regime between 2012 and 2017.

The report, which was tabled in UP assembly on Monday had found irregularities in 148 land leases, amounting to Rs 226.65 crore in 2017-18.

The CAG indicted mining department of causing revenue loss of nearly Rs 900 crore to the state exchequer during the Akhilesh Yadav regime.

Title: No role in bank-staff disputes: RBI tells Gujarat high court on bank strikes
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

RBI also asserted that it can issue directions to banks

AHMEDABAD: The Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ) on Tuesday told the Gujarat high court that though it has powers to take action against striking bank employees, the issue of ‘strikes’ does not fall in the ambit of banking policy and it has “no role in enforcement and implementation of regulations” framed by banks.

The RBI was responding to a PIL filed by trade federations of Gujarat seeking HC directions against employees of public sector banks saying that such strikes are against the public interest.

The HC asked the RBI whether it has any powers to act against striking bank employees.

The RBI has said, “Every bank has its own regulations on conduct and discipline of its employees and the RBI has no role in enforcement and implementation of such regulations. Even otherwise, there are separate labour laws to deal with the issue of strikes by employees.”

The RBI further said that it has supervisory and regulatory powers and powers to determine banking policy. It can act against employees of banks, if it feels that their actions are against the interest of monetary stability or sound economic growth. The RBI said that it has power under Section 35A of the Banking Regulation Act “to issue directions to banking companies generally or any banking company in particular, where it is satisfied that in public interest or in the interest of the banking policy or to prevent the affairs of the banking company being conducted in a manner prejudicial to the banking company or to secure the proper management of any banking company generally…but at the same time, it is relevant to state that disputes between the banks and their employees/union would not fall within the ambit of banking policy as defined in the Act.”

The RBI also asserted that it can issue directions to banks, but the trade federation cannot seek HC directions to RBI to exercise its discretion.

The hearing was adjourned by the court after it was submitted that the bank managements and employee unions are likely to hold meetings to resolve issues that were the cause for the strikes.

Title: School bus kills child, boy dies in class & student washed away
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kannur: A five-year-old boy was run over by his school bus hours after another student collapsed in the classroom and died, and yet another student went missing in a river here on Tuesday. Eight other students were injured when an autorickshaw ferrying them to school crashed into a compound wall at Chokli.

According to Peravoor police, Muhammed Rifan, son of Faizal and Razeena of Puthuserry, Peravoor, was fatally run over by his school bus after he had got down near his house at Kanjirapuzha Puthussery Road near Kanjirapuzha bridge around 4.30pm.

The deceased, a Class I student of Shanthi Nikethan English Medium School, and his brother were returning home in the same bus. While his brother alighted through the back door, Rifan used the front door. He was hit and run over by the bus while he was trying to cross the road to reach his home on the opposite side, said police. The bus driver, Vijesh, has been arrested and booked under Section 304 IPC, police said. The boy’s body has been shifted to Kannur Medical College hospital in Pariyaram for postmortem.

In another incident, a Class II student of Govt LP School in Velloor near Payyannur collapsed in the classroom on Tuesday afternoon.

Police said seven-year-old Thej P V, son of K Sreejith and P V Sajitha of Karikuzhi, had a heart ailment which lead to the death. Though school authorities rushed him to Kannur Govt Medical College Hospital, he was declared brought dead. The body would be handed over to the family after autopsy, police said.

In another incident, a 17-year-old Class XII student, Sandeep of Govt Higher Secondary School in Sreekandapuram, was washed away while he was swimming in the Paripayi river along with three other friends around 11am. There was strong current in the river and probably he got trapped in the sand, said police. He was not an expert swimmer, they said. Though the residents and fire and rescue service personnel launched a search operation, he could not be traced till evening.

Meanwhile, eight students and also their teacher as well as the driver suffered injuries when the autorickshaw taking them to school lost control and rammed into a wall at Chokli on Tuesday morning.

The three-wheeler, taking them to Ramakrishna LP School at Nidumbram, hit the wall around 9.30am. Two students who suffered serious injuries have been admitted in a super specialty hospital here while others are undergoing treatment at Thalassery.

Title: Metro slurry gushes out from under home, stokes panic in Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

The house in Gundi Chowk where the slurry has been gushing out from beneath

AHMEDABAD: Panic broke out in the Gundi Chowk area in Saraspur when a cave-in was reported from a house near RC High School. The residents rushed out and found chemicals mixed with mud flowing out of their house.

This is the second such incident reported on the underground Metro route from Apparel Park to Saraspur. On January 4, a similar case occurred near Karimni Chawl behind Sarangpur Bridge.

In the Gundi Chowk case, Nitin Dataniya — a resident of the affected house — called the fire brigade. Firefighters found that the cave-in inside the house had been caused by the digging of the Metro authorities. Metro officials were informed that chemicals were gushing out of the house and the officials reached the area.

A team of the Gujarat Metro Rail Corporation (GMRC) Limited officials began the cleaning operation. Amit Gupta, the chief general manager of the GMRC, said: “When the tunnel boring machine was operated, a chemical was pushed with force to soften the soil.” The chemical flows out if there is a borewell or some other outlet, Gupta said. “In this case, an undetected well caused the foam to gush out.”

Gupta said that the family will be shifted to a hotel and it will be compensated for the damages. According to Gupta, the authorities will resume work after all safety measures are taken.

A senior official said that usually the Metro carries out a survey of every house before work begins, but in many cases, residents are not aware of borewells or wells on the premises. Dataniya said that the house belongs to his relative and he lives there with his mother, sister, and sister-in-law.

Title: 12 IIM-Indore professors to boost smart policing in UP
Content:
Photo used for representational purpose

‘IIM-I to prepare a VIP route plan from Charbagh to 5 KD’

LUCKNOW: The Indian Institute of Management-Indore (IIM-I) is set to give a major boost to policing in the state by facilitating overall improvement in traffic management, beat policing and patrolling by UP 112. A 12-member team from IIM-Indore, headed by its director Himanshu Rai, will visit UP police headquarters on Wednesday to chalk out an action plan.Three senior IPS officers will work in close coordination with the team of experts to improve overall policing. ADG (law and order) PV Ramasastry will look after beat policing while ADG UP 112 Asim Arun and IG (traffic) Deepak Ratan will work to improve patrolling of UP 112 vehicles and traffic management, respectively.The development comes a month after UP police and IIM-Indore signed an MoU for a period of five years.This is for the first time that an IIM is assisting in a police force in rendering better services.Talking to TOI, director, IIM-Indore, Himanshu Rai said: “Our team will work with UP police to strengthen beat system, patrolling of UP-112 vehicles, and traffic management in five cities of Uttar Pradesh.”“In the first lap on Wednesday, professors will hold preliminary meetings with officials concerned and then initiate work by coordinating with senior IPS officers,” said Rai.Asim Arun, who is also the nodal head of the project, said integration between IIM and police would bring change in overall performance of the police force. “For beat policing, apps will be developed and digital record of cops and their interface with public will be maintained. Innovative and cost-effective ways of patrolling will also be explored,” Arun said.As part of traffic plan, the team will look at ways to improve traffic in Ghaziabad, Lucknow, Gautam Buddh Nagar, Kanpur and Varanasi.A senior police officer, who did not wish to be named, said: “For Lucknow, IIM-Indore has been asked to prepare a VIProute from Charbagh to 5, Kalidas Marg to ensure that traffic is not disturbed during any VIP movement.IIM-Indore will also impart psychological training to cops below gazetted rank officials to work out ways to not only improve their productivity but also suggest ways to reduce stress.

Title: Auto dealers offer discounts to clear BS-IV stock before March 31
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Nagpur: Following the Supreme Court’s order to impose a ban on sale and registration of Bharat Stage IV vehicles from April 1, 2020, 37 two-wheeler and 53 non-transport and transport vehicles’ dealers in the city are offering additional discounts to sell stocked vehicles.

“Though most of the automobile dealers have restricted orders of vehicles from the companies itself, now with the apex court’s order, many of us are offering additional discounts to clear the stock of BS-IV vehicles,” said AK Gandhi one of the top automobile dealers in the city. “We are not offering much discounts on vehicles which are in good demand,” he added.

Director of a city based four-wheeler dealer Himanshu Arya said that most of the four-wheeler dealers in the city too are offering stock clearing discounts ranging between Rs70,000 to Rs2 lakh. Buyers of two-wheelers are getting discounts between Rs5,000 and Rs10,000.

To a query, another automobile dealer said that they faced financial loss when BS-III vehicles were replaced by BS-IV. “We got very less time then but this time we have been preparing since early 2019 and most of the dealers had restricted their orders to the manufacturing companies itself,” the dealer said.

Transport commissioner Shekhar Channe told TOI that his office has received the apex court’s order and is preparing a notification stating BS-IV vehicles will not be registered after March 31, 2020. “After April 1, BS IV vehicles will neither be sold nor registered,” he said.

The order will be issued after the Supreme Court imposed a ban on sale and registration of BS IV, as BS-VI technology has already been introduced for cleaner fuel and environment safety.

Channe said all the regional transport officers in the state will be informed to give written instructions to vehicle dealers for submitting all registration approval cases of BS-IV vehicles before March end. So that its registration could be completed in time and the buyer gets all legal documents within the prescribed time frame.

He added that it has been noted that many a time customers wait till last moment hoping for discounts, so if the dealer wishes to provide discount then they must declare it before the deadline.

The commissioner has asked all RTOs to inform dealers about it and avail information about the available stock of BS-IV vehicles by end of this month. “Earlier, the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) had amended section 115 of allowed for registration and sale out of chassis of BS-IV vehicles till June 30 and September 30, this year,” confirmed a senior official from the regional transport office here.

But the Supreme Court recently rejected the transport ministry’s stand to given extension for registration of BS-IV vehicles.

Title: Uttrakhand: More than 400 youths protest lack of jobs outside secretariat
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

The protesters handed over a list of their demands to state officials

DEHRADUN: Dissatisfied with recent instance of cheating in the forest guard recruitment exam and alleged failure of state government to provide jobs, around 500 unemployed youth conducted a protest rally from Parade Ground to secretariat in the heart of the city on Tuesday. The protesters were still on a sit-in outside secretariat amid heavy rain till the time of filing of this report late at night.

The agitators kept on raising slogans against the state government and demanded cancellation of the forest guard examination. “In July 2018, chief minster Trivendra Singh Rawat had said that there are 18,000 vacant job posts. Why are those not being filled?" Bobby Panwar, chairperson, Uttarkahand Unemployed Persons’ Union, told TOI.

The protesters also claimed that officials are accepting computer certificate, mandatory for certain posts, issued from select centres only. “Computer certificates from several valid institutions are not being considered. The government should make it clear certificates of which institutes will be valid. There should be clarity on this when the vacancy is announced,” added Panwar.

Another demand of protesters was that the government must release an annual calendar of upcoming recruitment examinations. “Other states publish their annual examinations calendar. Why can’t Uttarakhand publish such calendars? The state government must ensure fair play in regard to employment,” said Panwar.

Another agitator Kamlesh Bhatt, a member of Uttarakhand Berojgaar Sangh , told TOI: “Our cause is genuine. Most of us are either unemployed or contractual workers. We all want a stable job. But the state government is unable to provide us any opportunity."

The protesters handed over a list of their demands to state government officials and also sought resignation of the officers who failed in conducting the forest guard examination properly.

Meanwhile, S Raju, chairman of Uttarakhand Subordinate Service Selection Commission (UKSSSC), assured the agitating youths of providing fair job opportunities to all. “Ever since its formation in 2015, UKSSSC has conducted over 66 examinations and all were aimed at providing jobs to the youths. Among these examinations, irregularities were found in only six examinations and five of those were caught by the UKSSSC itself. Stringent action was taken in every case,” added Raju.

Santosh Badoni, secretary of UKSSSC, added that "all those who will be found guilty of committing or helping cheating in the forest guard recruitment examination will be barred from appearing in any of the UKSSSC examination in future."

Title: Soon, Chalai market to have warehouse facility worth Rs 8cr
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Chalai is set to have one of the biggest warehousing facilities for a commercial area in the city.

During the inauguration of the first phase of the Chalai Heritage Project on Tuesday, tourism minister Kadakampally Surendran said that the warehouse will be one of the major projects being implemented in Chalai.

The warehouse facility will be built as part of the Smart City project. The site owned by TRIDA at Erumakuzhy has been chosen for the facility. Smart City Thiruvananthapuram Ltd CEO P Balakiran said that the project will be implemented at a cost of Rs 8.1 crore. It will cater to the needs of Chalai Market which extends from East Fort to Killipalam.

“The proposed warehouse will have six huge chambers for storage. One chamber will be used exclusively for cold storage and remaining chambers will be used for general warehouse purpose. The market is badly in need of an advanced warehousing facility and this will be a key step in ensuring scientific and proper storage,” said Balakiran.

Proposed to be built in over 2,500sq.m, the warehouse will also address grave concerns regarding use of chemicals to extend the storage life of perishables.

“If you look at Chalai Market, it is a place where majority of the products being sold are perishable goods. In the absence of a proper warehouse facility, people often resort to use of chemicals or any other method to ensure that they do not suffer loss. Once this new facility comes up at Erumakuzhy, merchants can make use of a scientific storage mechanism and consumers can look forward to purchasing healthy and safe food items. This will have multiple benefits for a place like Chalai,” said Balakiran.

While launching the revamped vegetable market at Chalai, minister Kadakampally Surendran spoke of the upcoming projects for city’s busiest commercial hub and also sought more co-operation from merchants. “In Kozhikode, the revamp of ‘Mittayi Theruvu’ was estimated to take 18 months, but the project could be finished in seven months. Here it took a long time to complete the project to revamp the vegetable market. The merchants should introspect as to who is going to benefit from this project,” he said.

The minister said that there have been attempts to torpedo this scheme and some of the merchants fell into the trap of those trying to topple the scheme. The revamp of meat market and fish market should be completed within a quicker time frame. “Every project requires some compromises. We will face some difficulties during relocation but with co-operation, the project could be completed within three-four months,” the minister said.

Architect G Sankar, who designed the Heritage project, also recalled the issues that the team had to deal especially with regard to relocation of vendors. A total of 225 vendors are being shifted to the new vegetable stalls. Sankar said that some of the area could be used for rehabilitating meat vendors till new meat and fish stalls are constructed.

Title: Nagpur police quell attempted Vidarbha statehood stir
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Police clamp down on protesters from VRAS near Manish Nagar

NAGPUR: An attempted agitation in support of statehood for Vidarbha, christened ‘Rail Roko Andolan’, was quelled by city police at Manish Nagar Railway Crossing on Tuesday.

Close to 700 activists from Vidarbha Rajya Andolan Samiti (VRAS) tried to rush to the railway crossing, shouting slogans of ‘Jai Vidarbha’ from a nearby garden — where they had gathered in the morning from various parts of Vidarbha. They were stopped by Nagpur police ahead of the railway crossing.

A few activists who entered the railway crossing were rounded up by the railway protection force (RPF) and government railway police (GRP), before they could stop a passing train.

Ram Neole, the chief organizer of VRAS, said that it is “high time that the Central government creates a separate state for Vidarbha”. Neole added that the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) had already lost Maharashtra, and proponents of Vidarbha statehood could completely wipe out the party from Vidarbha too, if the demand is not heeded.

The Rail Roko agitation was carried out since railway is a Central subject, and creating a separate state for Vidarbha is also in the Prime Minster Narendra Modi-led Central government’s court.

Former MLA and VRAS senior leader Wamanrao Chatap said that the demand for Vidarbha statehood was “a 103 years old”, and that the Centre needs to take a decision in this regard. The farmers’ issue in the state is very serious and the government should take immediate steps to resolve them, he added.

Chatap also demanded 200 units of free power for the people of Vidarbha, along the lines of the Delhi government.

The RPF, Nagpur police force and GRP were alert to the situation as they knew about the planned protest in advance. Around 300 activists were detained and sent to Sonegaon police station, including Ram Neole and Wamanrao Chatap.

Title: 64-year-old Ahmedabad man loses Rs 45,000 after ATM card swap
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

Ahmedabad: A 64-year-old man from New Ranip on Monday filed a complaint with the Sabarmati police stating that a man aged around 25 had cheated him by withdrawing Rs 45,000 with his ATM card.

The complainant said that the accused had swapped his card at an ATM centre in the New Ranip area on Sunday evening.

In his FIR filed with the Sabarmati police, Nikul Adhwaryu, a resident of Gold Apartments in New Ranip, said that he works as a supervisor with a private company and had gone to the ATM on Sunday evening to withdraw cash.

Adhwaryu said that the ATM had run out of cash. When he was about to leave, the accused entered and offered to help him. The man took Adhwaryu’s ATM card and tried to make transactions. After a while, he told Adhwaryu that the ATM had run out of cash and gave back a card.

Adhwaryu drove back home on his scooter and mid-way he received a message that Rs 45,000 had been deducted from his account. When he checked his bank statement, he found that the money had been withdrawn in three transactions from the same ATM. On checking his card, Adhwaryu found that it was not his.
