This story is from February 26, 2020

The silver trophy that was first given in 1942 to the winners

Vadodara: It was in 1942 that the first Maharani Shantadevi Inter-School Tournament first took off in the city under the royal Gaekwadi rule. The Baroda Cricket Association (BCA) has now launched this tournament to tap the talent from schools in the city. The idea is to catch them young and nourish their talent for higher level of the sport, said BCA officials.

“From former test cricketer D K Gaekwad, who played the first tournament in 19 42 to Kiran More, Nayan Mongia, Anshuman Gaekwad, Atul Bedade to Rakesh and Tushar Arothe, every Baroda cricketer has played in this inter-school tourney,” said Milind Pradhan, member, BCA tours and technical committee.

BCA officials had said earlier that there was no club cricket and selection of talented players for Cooch Behar Trophy was done on the basis of Maharani Shantadevi Inter-School Tournament. This tournament was organized every year from 1942 to 2015 when it was suddenly stopped. The then BCA management said that it couldn’t fit this tournament in their annual calendar due to several other tourneys but some accused the association of side-lining school tournament for promoting club cricket.

BCA president, Pranav Amin, however, stepped in this year and decided to re-launch the tournament. “Junior and school cricket are very important for us so we decided to start this tournament again. We will now fix a schedule for this tournament in our annual calendar so that the schools can begin preparations in advance,” Amin said.

Title: Polls for 3 RS seats from Raj on March 26
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Jaipur: The election commission of India on Tuesday announced election of 55 members to the Rajya Sabha from 17 states including three from Rajasthan, whose terms are completing in April this year.

The poll will take place on March 26 and the result will be announced the same day. The election process has to be completed before March 30. The notification will be issued on March 6, while the last date for filing nomination is March 13. The scrutiny of nominations will take place on March 16 and withdrawal of nominations on March 18. The term of Rajya Sabha MPs from Rajasthan — Narayanlal Panchariya, Ram Narayan Dudi and Vijay Goel — is coming to an end on April 9. All three are BJP MPs.

TNN

Title: Desludging workers asked to avoid manual scavenging
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Trichy: Desludging operators in the city have been told not to deploy manual scavengers in feacal sludge apart from ensuring necessary safety gear for their workers, during the advocacy meeting organised for desludging vehicle owners and their employees here on Tuesday.

Addressing the gathering, I Ambalavanan, project director of People’s Development Initiatives, urged the owners to purchase safety gears such as boots, mask and hand gloves for all their labourers cleaning septic tanks. “Owners should also ensure that their employees are using the safety gears while on duty,” Ambalavanan added.

Organised jointly by NGOs working in solid waste management, the event saw representatives of desludging operators in various parts of the city participating in an interactive session to explain the hardships they face. There are around 55 desludging operators and 200 workers in the city, organisers said.

“Even if the property owner ask the desludging labourers to enter the septic tanks, the labourers should resist and avoid entering the tanks containing faecal waste. Similarly, cleaning the septic tanks during night should be prohibited,” said Sugantha Priscilla L, senior consultant, CWIS-IIHS.

The desludging operators were also told not to dump the faecal waste in public places but only at the decanting stations of the corporation. Workers that participated in the meeting were encouraged to check their health on a regular basis.

Title: Embroidery unit gutted in Udhna
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Surat: Fire broke out in an embroidery unit located in Harinagar-3 at Udhna on Tuesday evening. No casualty was reported.

Sources in the fire and emergency department of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) said that the fire broke out in the embroidery unit near the Shivkrupa society at Harinagar-3 in Udhna at about 5:35 pm. About three embroidery machines, eight sewing machines and fabric material including saris, laces and dress material were gutted in the fire.

Fire officials stated that the embroidery unit Mahavir Creation is owned by Kishore Shinde. There was a blast in the electricity metre box inside the unit. The fabric material kept near the metre box caught fire and that it spread in the entire unit very rapidly.

Chief fire officer, Basant Pareek said, “The fire incident was reported in the embroidery unit located in the residential area. The fire tenders immediately rushed at the spot and starting the fire fighting exercise. Luckily, the workers and owner of the unit managed to come out of the unit when the fire broke out.”

Title: Bengaluru: Woman working out in park gets advice on dress code
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: A 30-year-old woman who was warming up at a Mathikere park where her husband was jogging on Sunday morning was in for a rude shock: a middle-aged man not only gave her a piece of unsolicited advice on dress code but also filmed her on his mobile.

The man showed the video to other women in the park and they too joined him in telling her what she should be wearing in a park meant for families.

The woman approached a relative working with the police department, and after a few hours, DCP (north) N Shashikumar called her and apologised for the inconvenience caused.

According to the woman, the incident happened around 10.30am at JP Park in Mathikere. While she began to warm up, her husband went for a 30-minute jog. After she finished warming up, the woman removed her sweater and got ready for the workout, and her husband, who returned from the jog, wanted to film her exercising. The woman is a fitness instructor.

Meanwhile, a stranger who was moving around on his two-wheeler inside the park, stopped a few metres away from the couple, parked his vehicle and walked towards her.

“He said, ‘Wearing such clothes is not allowed in this park. This is a family place and not like Cubbon Park or Lalbagh’. He took out his mobile and started filming me,” the woman told TOI.

The woman was startled and her husband told the stranger his wife was not wearing anything objectionable. When the husband tried to reason it out with the stranger, the latter began speaking rudely. The husband promptly filmed the stranger’s uncouth conduct.

The man walked towards a few middle-aged women taking a stroll in the park and spoke to them about the couple. “He told us he showed my video to the women and they also objected to the way I had dressed. One of the women questioned me in a very low tone why I was doing such a thing when I was clearly not doing anything wrong,” she said.

The shocked couple went back to their house in the same area, where they have been living for a year. They are regulars at the park on weekends but Sunday was the first time they were in for the humiliating experience. “I contacted my relative who works with police’s Parihar women’s helpline. A few hours later, I received a call from a DCP who apologised,” she said. “It is a family park, which is why I felt safe to wear what I wore,” she said.

“There was an argument between two parties over dress code. However, the situation was brought under control by locals who intervened. No police complaint was filed,” Yeshwantpur police said.

Title: Conmen hack Bengaluru hospital's bank account, divert Rs 17 lakh after cloning sim
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Cybercriminals targeted the bank account of a Bengaluru hospital and siphoned off Rs 17 lakh after cloning the official sim card attached to it and adding unknown members as online banking beneficiaries.

Spandana Nursing Home authorities have lodged a police complaint and an investigation by cybercrime sleuths is under way.

Hospital sources said the online banking fraud came to light on February 19 after an official postpaid cellphone number attached to a bank account of the hospital chain went defunct. “On February 14, the Airtel sim was suddenly inactive with incoming and outgoing calls being barred. We desperately contacted the Airtel helpline requesting the service be restored, but in vain. After repeated efforts from us — a representative even visited the Airtel kiosk — the sim was finally functional on February 20,” a senior executive from Spandana told TOI.

While the sim was defunct, fraudsters had managed to make 12 online transactions from Spandana Pharma’s Central Bank of India (CBI) account (Rajajinagar branch). They diverted Rs 17 lakh to various unknown bank accounts through IMPS and NEFT.

“We realised the money had been transferred only after the mobile number was restored. We got to know that the culprits had cloned the mobile number attached to the CBI account and had also managed to hack the account and add numerous beneficiaries to it,” added the executive.

Dr S Preeti, chief medical director of Spandana Pharma, lodged the complaint with Yeshwantpur police last week, urging them to track down the fraudsters and retrieve the stolen money.

Investigators suspect that a person well aware of the mobile number being attached to the hospital’s bank account had illegally obtained a duplicate of the Airtel sim card after possibly reporting the original as stolen or lost. The person then used the new sim to operate the bank account and obtain OTPs. The fraudsters also managed to access the CBI account, add six beneficiaries and transfer Rs 15 lakh on February 19 and Rs 2 lakh on February 20. Two more bank accounts of Spandana attached to the same number remained untouched, sources said.

Title: CAA Protest in Chennai: Case against eight students in Thanjavur
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

THANJAVUR: Police have registered a case against 8 students of Rajah Serfoji Government Arts College in Thanjavur on charges of blocking the road while protesting against Citizenship Amendment Act recently. Of the 8 students, 5 of them are third-year students while the rest are studying in the second year.

According to police, the case was registered against the students for causing inconvenience to the public while holding a protest on December 16, 2019. The college administration was also intimidated of the action. When contacted the police refused to divulge details of the cases registered.

Title: Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamaath to hold statewide anti-CAA stir on February 29
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamaath has decided to conduct a statewide protest on February 29 and a prison filling protest on March 18 against the CAA.

Decided at the general body meeting of the TNTJ presided by its state president Shamsullah Rahmani on Tuesday, the event saw a participation of hundreds of members from all over the state. They said that 11 chief ministers have raised their voice against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). Tamil Nadu government should pass a resolution against the CAA.

They also condemned the attack on the anti-CAA protestors using weapons including guns who were protesting peacefully in New Delhi. Only those who did not believe in the law would act in this undemocratic manner which was highly condemnable they said.

Home minister Amit Shah who is in charge of the Delhi police should take stern action against the officials who are responsible for these attacks, they said.

TNTJ state general secretary Mohamed, state treasurer Raheem, state vice president Abdul Rehman and others participated.

Meanwhile, the anti-CAA protest at Mahaboobpalayam entered into 12th day on Tuesday which saw a participation of a large number of men and women. The protest was launched soon after the Chennai police used force against the protestors who staged a peaceful protest in Vannarapettai recently. A posse of police was deployed there to make sure the protest did not go out of control.

Title: Skill training helps non-engineering students bag technology jobs
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Students trained under the New-collar Employability Skills Program attend a workshop in Bengaluru on Tuesday

BENGALURU: Last year, BSc student Sona J, 20, signed up for employability skill classes where programming languages, coding, data analysis and cloud computing were taught, skipping her regular classes.

A year later, she says it was the best decision of her life. The girl has been showered with job offers as an analyst in three IT companies, including Wipro and Mphasis.

Sona is among the 2,537 non-engineering students who attended science and cloud computing courses under the New-collar Employability Skills Program late last year. The training was imparted in 23 colleges across Karnataka, NCR and Haryana, jointly by IBM and Nasscom Foundation, and ran up to 250 hours. Almost 1,000 students have landed jobs that were earlier thought to be the domain of engineers.

Bharath Baladhanvi, BCA student of National College, Basavanagudi, comes from a family of priests. His family wanted him to specialise in Sanskrit, but after attending the programme, he plans to enhance the value of Sanskrit through technology. “I have already presented a paper on how Sanskrit can be used as an analytical language,” said the 20-year-old who got offers from four MNCs. “I plan to accept Deloitte’s offer as an analyst,” he beamed.

Prathibha, 19, originally from Hubballi, lost her adoptive parents when she was in high school. She was then forced to go from pillar to post until she ended up at Vijaya College’s Hostel in Bengaluru two years ago. Soon, a relative who supported her education also backed out.

Her computer science HOD got her admitted to an orphanage — Abalashrama in Basavanagudi — two years ago. With a job offer from an MNC, Prathibha, a BSc student, is hoping for a better placement. “If I start working, I can’t stay at the ashram any more. So, I am looking for an offer that can support me well,” she explained.

Box: Few women in IT workforce at higher levels

Geetha Kannan of Wequity revealed the percentage of women in the IT workforce goes down from 34% at the entry level to just 2% at higher levels. She called it ‘leaking pipeline’ and blamed it on the mindset regarding work culture. “It starts from an individual’s mindset. Women are clear about their education but not so much about their career. This needs to change. Organisations must come up with more family-friendly policies,” she explained.

Santhosh Abraham, VP of Nasscom Foundation, said there was a gap in the workforce and women’s visibility in the fields of AI and technology. “Women comprise only 22% of the workforce,” he said.

However, Girish Kamath, VP and MD of Scientific Games, said they do find a lot of women in technical fields but don’t come across as much talent for the positions of artists and designers.

Title: More dazzle on the anvil for Diamond City’s bright skyline
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Surat: Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) has secured the crucial World Bank funding for its ambitious Tapi riverfront project.

The civic body is expected to get Rs 1,500 crore for the project, which is expected to be face changer for the Diamond City’s landscape.

Recently, the WB bank team had visited Surat in January and held series of meetings to discuss the project and funding technicalities.

“Our meetings with the WB have been fruitful and they are satisfied. We are hopeful of getting Rs 1,500 crore for the riverfront development project. This will give a major push to city’s infrastructure,’’ Banchhanidhi Pani, municipal commissioner, told TOI.

According to SMC officials, the total project cost is pegged at Rs 3,904 crore.

“Besides WB funding, we will be raising funds by monetising the land on the riverfront for commercial purpose. Our aim is to expedite the project within the next few months,’’ Pani added.

The first phase of the project is being clubbed with Tapi Shuddhikaran project and work for dredging the river to increase its carrying capacity and construction of embankment on both sides will also be taken up along with the recreational centres and creation of green space.

Surat Urban Development Authority (SUDA) and state government is also involved in the riverfront project as some parts fall in their jurisdiction.

Title: Action against tour touts on CM’s order
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kota: Following chief minister Ashok Gehlot’s orders, the Special Operation Group (SOG) on Monday registered a case against travel agents, who in pretext of giving jobs, extort huge sums from unemployed youths and send them to Iraq where they are made to work day and night without adequate food and salary.

Led by state youth Congress general secretary Charmesh Sharma, a 27-member delegation of youths from Rajasthan, who returned to India on February 18 from Najaf city in Iraq where they were sent to work and were robbed of their visa and passport, met Gehlot at his official residence in Jaipur on Monday and narrated their plight demanding immediate action against the tour and travel agents. The tour agents extorted nearly Rs 1,20 lakh from each of the 27 youths and sent them to Iraq on tour visa instead of work visa, the delegation told CM. Taking a note of the grievances, CM directed SOG to lodge a case against the travel agents and initiate probe, Sharma said. TNN

Title: Nagaur Dalit case: SHO benched
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Jaipur: One more person has been arrested in the case related to torture and humiliation of two Dalit cousins at a motorbike service centre in Panchaudi area of Nagaur district on February 16.

A series of videos of the incident had gone viral following which an FIR was filed on February 19. Panchaudi SHO Rajpal Singh has been sent to police lines for dereliction of duty. Singh has been replaced by Shambhu Dayal Meena, who has been posted as working SHO. Dalit activists, who visited Son Nagar village to meet the Dalit cousins, had also raised questions on the role of police in the case. “We have arrested one Hem Singh late on Monday night. It is the eightth arrest made in the case,” said Mukul Sharma, circle officer, Nagaur. He said one of the arrested accused was produced before a local court, which granted him police custody for a day. The action of sending the SHO to police lines was taken a day after RLP MLA Narayan Beniwal had alleged that the incident happened due to poor law and order situation. He had accused police of not acting promptly and for exterting pressure on the victim into settling the case with the accused. TNN

Title: Teen robbed of bike, other valuables
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

A teenager was robbed of bike, mobile phones and cash at knifepoint by a gang of four people at Ring Road on Sunday night.In his complaint registered with Anna Nagar police on Monday, M Mohammed Hasan Adil, 19, from Kalimanglaam stated that he was travelling on his sports bike on the Ring Road. A gang of four intercepted him at Vandiyur and questioned him about his destination. When he refused to answer, one of them suddenly took out a knife and brandished him while other frisked him.

They took away Rs 4000, two mobile phones, a wristwatch and his bike and threatened him with dire consequences. He was later made to run from the spot.

Title: Physics jokes turn a comedian into author
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Yash Chauhan during one of his ‘humourous’ sessions in a city school

Vadodara: Knowing that his funny bones work overtime, Yash Chauhan, a post-graduate student of physics at MS University, wanted to make a career in stand-up comedy. But it all changed when he hit a eureka moment while teaching physics to a friend’s brother in Class X. When his experiments with infusing a little humour to make learning easier hit the jackpot, Chauhan turned into a writer!

Now, Chauhan has written a book for Class X students after getting inspired by his own experiments. The book titled ‘Science in 24 hours’ contains same old lessons but in concise format which help students grasp all the important concepts, and score well too.

“The book contains important points in different colours to identify the complex and easy concepts,” explained Chauhan, who has made videos of these concepts and shared on YouTube where he tries to explain these though jokes.

“There are guides and digest books available in the market. But these only help students learn questions and answers by heart without really understanding the concepts. My book summarizes these in the comic form,” Chauhan said.

The young author claims that one concept which can take 15 hours of teaching in a school can be understood in 40 minutes through his book. To test its applicability, Chauhan also conducted workshops in several schools in Vadodara and got tremendous response from students as well as the school management.

“As I did stand-up shows, so I don’t have stage anxiety and science gives me enough content to make puns and jokes. I cracked jokes during the workshops which attracted students who found the learning easy,” he said.

Chauhan has been approached by publishers and concept schools for publishing the book and teach, but he has turned down all requests. “MSU has shown interest in publishing the book so it is better that a government body publishes the book,” said Chauhan. He now plans to take up research in physics after finishing his MSc course.

Meanwhile, Chauhan is also working on a science book for Class IX students and a physics books for Class XI and XII students.

Title: Delhi: Board exams put off in riot-hit areas
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Security personnel conduct flag march during clashes between those against and those supporting the CAA in nor... Read More

NEW DELHI: Following Delhi high court direction asking Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) to reschedule the board exams , the board confirmed that the Wednesday examination for Class X and XII in northeast Delhi has been postponed. However, in other parts, the exams will take place as scheduled, it clarified.

On Wednesday, English paper for Class X and web application/media for Class XII was scheduled at 86 centres in northeast Delhi, including government and private schools. The next date of the exam will be notified shortly, the board said.

The notice issued by CBSE read: “Based on the request of Directorate of Education and to avoid inconvenience to students, staff and parents, the board has decided to postpone the exam scheduled for February 26 in northeast Delhi.”

Deputy chief minister and education minister Manish Sisodia had also requested the board to reschedule the examination. The government and private schools in northeast Delhi will be shut on Wednesday.

Earlier, Justice Rajiv Shakdher had asked CBSE to take the decision as soon as possible and convey it to all concerned, adding that children can’t be put at risk. It had then posted the matter for Wednesday morning.

Title: Gujarat: 11 SRP men injured in bus accident
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

VADODARA: Eleven state reserve police (SRP) personnel returning from Ahmedabad to Godhra after attending the ‘Namaste Trump’ event duties were injured when the bus they were travelling in met with an accident near Timbi Patia near Godhra on Tuesday morning.

The incident took place when the front tyre of the bus burst and the driver lost control and hit the divider on the highway. The bus turned over injuring the people inside it.

Two other buses carrying SRP jawans were following the bus that met with the accident. They rushed to the aid of their colleagues on reaching the spot and ensured that they reached the Godhra Civil Hospital.

The 11 injured jawans included three who broke their limbs, while the others received fractures and were taken to the SSG Hospital at Vadodara for treatment.

Title: Rajasthan: Villagers wait for slain Sikar cop’s body for cremation
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

File pic of head constable Ratan Lal with his family.

JAIPUR: Villagers of Tihawali in Sikar district is mourning the death of 42-year-old Delhi police head constable Ratan Lal who was killed during a clash between pro- and anti-CAA groups in Delhi on Monday.

The villagers are awaiting Lal’s body to arrive in the village for cremation .

However, Sikar district administration has not been informed about his cremation. “So far, we have not received any information about the place and time of cremation,” district collector Yajna Singh Dev told TOI.

The villagers, however, have started preparations for his cremation. “The entire village is awaiting the body of the brave policeman. His body is expected to arrive late in the night. His cremation will be held in Sikar around 9am on Wednesday,” said Prakash Singh Shekhawat, a resident of the village.

Tihawali is the village where Lal had spent his childhood. He was a graduate and his father was a farmer, who died 10 years ago.

Lal had made his village proud when he was selected for the Republic Day parade. He was an inspiration for the entire village especially youths, villagers told TOI.

Lal had shifted to Delhi with his family, but his mother and his brothers are living in Tihawali. He had joined Delhi Police in 1998 and he is survived by his wife and three children.

Title: This mad violence must end: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kejriwal, his deputy Manish Sisodia and several other AAP MLAs went to Rajghat with a prayer for restoring pea... Read More

NEW DELHI: As news of arson and violence poured in from different parts of northeast Delhi, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal hit the ground on Tuesday, urging people to refrain from rioting. After a meeting with Union home minister Amit Shah, the CM — accompanied by his deputy Manish Sisodia and several other MLAs — went to Rajghat with a prayer for restoring peace.

Kejriwal, Sisodia and others also visited the injured policemen and other victims of the violence at various hospitals. He instructed the authorities to ensure the best-possible treatment for them. “I met the people hurt in the violence, including those who had bullet injuries. I have instructed (hospital authorities) that special care be given to the injured, more beds arranged and doctors roped in,” Kejriwal said.

He later visited the Burari residence of slain policeman, Ratan Lal. “This mad violence should be stopped immediately. Everyone should work for peace. I met home minister Amit Shah and he assured me that, if required, additional forces will be sent to contain the violence. I am continuously tracking the developments,” Kejriwal said. The CM appreciated the role of police officers whom he met at a private hospital. “I met many police officers who were injured in the violence. There was a DCP and an ACP among them. The DCP was severely injured and had to undergo brain surgery. These police personnel risked their own lives to protect others,” he said.

Lieutenant governor Anil Baijal, too, visited various hospitals to meet the victims.

Earlier in the day, Kejriwal directed district magistrates and sub-divisional magistrates posted in the riot-affected areas to organise peace marches and meetings with people of all faiths. The CM chaired a high-level meeting at his residence that was attended by AAP and BJP MLAs from the affected areas as well as chief secretary Vijay Dev and officials from fire services and other departments. The fire department was asked to coordinate with Delhi Police and respond quickly to situations that needed intervention. “All issues can be sorted out amicably. Violence will not provide any solution,” Kejriwal stated after the meeting.

“One policeman has died, apart from some civilians. All of them were citizens of the country. Many people have lost shops, houses and vehicles in the violence. This is not a good thing. It is a loss for everyone... someone has suffered loss today... someone will suffer tomorrow,” Kejriwal said. The MLAs told the CM that, in most places, the deployment of police force was far lower than required. “They also complained that police don’t have orders to take action. Unless police get order to fire in the air or conduct lathicharge, they would not be able to take action,” Kejriwal said.

He suggested that the borders of Delhi be sealed to contain the violence. “MLAs from the border areas have complained that people from outside are coming in. There is a need to seal the borders. Those found acting suspiciously must be arrested immediately,” Kejriwal said. He instructed district authorities to ensure that local MLAs were present at the peace committee meetings. The CM also stressed on the need to make announcements for peace from temples and mosques.

Just before midnight on Monday, several AAP functionaries sat on a dharna outside LG Anil Baijal’s office, demanding a meeting with him and action against the rioters. The dharna continued for several hours. They claimed that the rioters were moving around unchecked by police. Through the night, violence was reported from different parts of northeast Delhi. “We were forced to sit on dharna because we were getting distress calls from different areas. Police were not taking calls,” Burari MLA Sanjeev Jha, who was among the MLAs on dharna, said.

Title: DHFL News: DHFL assets don’t seem to be proceeds of crime
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court observed that the assets of Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Ltd (DHFL) did not appear to be the “proceeds of crime” when it recently granted bail to its promoter Kapil Wadhawan in a money laundering case that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating against deceased drug smuggler Iqbal Memon alias Mirchi.

In the detailed order that became available on Tuesday, the court said there did not appear to be a direct relation between the amalgamation of the five dummy companies of the Wadhawans which received loans from DHFL into an entity called Sunblink and the purchase of Mirchi’s three properties in Worli.

Dheeraj Wadhawan, who is Kapil’s brother, controlled Sunblink, which bought the three Mirchi properties in 2010.

The ED had alleged that a part of Rs 1,500 crore received from DHFL by the five dummy companies controlled by Kapil Wadhawan were diverted to Mirchi.

The ED had alleged that DHFL had given a Rs 50 crore loan to Sunblink to purchase Mirchi’s property though there was no property in the name of the company. Apart from that, it said DHFL diverted a loan of Rs 1,500 crore — with interest it is Rs 2,186 crore — to five shell companies in 2011-12 “without any legal authority and under the garb of housing loan etc to individual customers”.

The ED said that while clearing loans to the five entities, procedure was not followed as security for the loan was not created and the issue was not cleared by the board’s finance committee but signed only by the promoters, Dheeraj and Kapil Wadhawan.

Later, the five dummy companies were merged with Sunblink to cover alleged diversions of loans acquired from DHFL.

The court said it did not appear that Wadhawan had played any role in the transactions that had taken place before 2010 in respect of these properties. “There is material to show that those three properties were purchased from Iqbal Mirchi in the name of Sunblink, which was opened in the name of accused Sunny Bhatija by accused Dheeraj Wadhawan and not by the applicant (Kapil Wadhawan),” the court said.

The court said that even while granting bail to other accused Ranjeet Bindra and Rinku Deshpande , it had held that they had not played any role in respect of the transactions that had taken place before year 2010. “Same is the fact situation so far as accused is concerned as allegations against him are that he advanced loan from DHFL to Sunblink in the year 2010 due to which rule of parity can be applied in his favour …” the court said.

Mirchi allegedly used proceeds of crime — money generated from his crimes — to purchase the three Worli properties. The court stated that the ED prima facie established that the three properties are the proceeds of crime.

Pointing to the statements of Bindra and a witness, the court said that it showed that Wadhawan had not participated in the meeting held in London with Iqbal Mirchi in respect of the transactions for those three properties. The court said that this conduct of Wadhawan was a relevant factor while deciding his bail plea.

“It does not appear that any other offence is registered against accused previously, which means that he is not having criminal past due to which, contention of respondent (ED) is not acceptable that if enlarged on bail he may tip off the other suspected persons to evade further investigation and he will tamper with the evidence by pressurising the witnesses,” the court said.

The court said that having regards to these aspects, the nature of allegations available against the accused and the fact that he does not have criminal past, it was of the opinion that he was entitled to bail.

Title: Dream City’s corporate office to embrace green
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Surat: The development of prestigious Diamond Research and Mercantile (DREAM) City at Khajod has been put on the fast track with the approval for the construction of the corporate office at the cost of Rs 27.75 crore

The DREAM City Pvt Ltd, a special purpose vehicle formed by the state government, is taking up the construction of the six-storey corporate office and iconic entry gate.

“The SPV has approved the construction of a six-storey corporate office for the staff and board members at the cost of Rs 27.75 crore. In addition, we are also constructing an iconic entry gate at the cost of Rs six crore. Dream City is close to the airport as well as proposed metro train station. This is a big ticket project for the city and it will turn out as an international bustling business hub soon,’’ Banchhanidhi Pani, managing director, Dream City, told TOI.

The corporate office will come up on the 3,250 sq m land located opposite the Surat Diamond Bourse (SDB), world’s largest diamond bourse, which is under construction at the DREAM City.

The corporate office will be developed on the green concept covering the construction area of 12,775 square feet.

The iconic entry gate will be 60 m wide and 15 m tall. The office will have all facilities including elevators for the visitors, sky-deck at the height of 25 foot with facilities of viewing area, food court, telescope point, sitting area and a dedicated area for exhibiting the heritage of the city, facilities for those with disabilities and digital checking facilities for the vehicles entering.

The entry gate will be based on the round-shape diamond design and that the skydeck will be designed in the shape of a diamond ring.

Surat Diamond Bourse (SDB) is coming up on the 35 acres of land at the cost of Rs 2,500 crore. A project envisaged by the diamond barons, SDB is going to be the second diamond bourse after the Bharat Diamond Bourse (SDB) in Mumbai. The booking of the offices is already completed and majority of the diamantaires from Mumbai, Surat and Antwerp have booked their office space at the SDB.

Title: Vadodara man gives triple ‘talaq’ to wife
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: Eight persons of a family living in Chhani were booked for cruelty, dowry and Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Acts after a 22-year-old woman consumed unprescribed medicines to end her life.

Shabnam Pathan, who is currently living with her parents, had consumed medicines after her sister-in-law allegedly called and abused her on February 22. Pathan was asked by her in-laws to leave the house last month as she had not brought any dowry at the time of marriage. Pathan had married Noor Ahmed in 2017 and the couple was blessed with a son last year.

In her complaint, Pathan told police that after their son’s birth, Noor Ahmed did not behave properly with her. He used to fight with her over petty reasons and harass her. Last month, following a heated argument, Noor Ahmed said ‘talaq’ thrice to Pathan to divorce her and left from the house. After her husband left, Pathan’s father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law and sisters-in-law allegedly harassed and asked her to leave their house.

After consuming medicines on February 22, her family members rushed her to SSG Hospital where she is currently undergoing treatment. On Monday, as her health improved, she gave a statement to police based on which an offence was registered at the Fatehgunj police station.

Title: Goa seeks Supreme Court stay on Mhadei project
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Supreme Court

PANAJI: The state government on Tuesday filed an application before the Supreme Court seeking an interim relief to restrain Karnataka from carrying out construction or any other activity on the Mhadei .

The chief minister’s office said after senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi pleaded before the bench presided by justice D Y Chandrachud for urgent hearing, the court posted the matter for March 2.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant said by seeking a stay from the Supreme Court against construction activities by Karnataka, the state government has sent out a clear signal that it was serious in protecting the Mhadei.

Sawant also said the opposition’s demand for a white paper on the Mhadei was pure hogwash.

“These are the same people who were in power at that time (when the tribunal announced the award) and should be held responsible for the Mhadei issue. Instead of demanding a white paper, they should support government morally and politically to win the Mhadei battle,” Sawant told TOI.

The state approached the Supreme Court in view of reports that Karnataka will move to start work on its Kalasa-Bhandura water drinking projects on the Mhadei river following interim order of the court.

Last week, the Supreme Court, in an interim order, directed the Centre to notify the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal’s award of August 14, 2018, but said it was subject to the outcome of the petitions filed by the riparian states—Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra—against the award.

The Supreme Court also admitted Goa government’s special leave petition challenging the award and posted it for final hearing on July 15, 16 and 24.

After TOI pointed out how the Centre cannot notify the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal award of August 14, 2018 for another six months as the tribunal had been granted an extension till August 19 for giving the final award, Sawant had said that his government would approach the Supreme Court to “recall” its interim order asking the Union government to notify the tribunal order.

In August 2018, the three-decade-old dispute between the three states over sharing of the Mhadei waters ended with the tribunal rejecting Karnataka’s demand for 36.5tmc ft, and allotted it only 13.4tmc ft, including 3.9 tmc ft for drinking purposes through diversions, against its demand for 7.5tmc ft

Sawant had said that during the hearings in the apex court on July 15, 16 and 24, the state government will furnish enough evidence to prove that Karnataka has diverted water illegally from the Mhadei basin.

The state government, in the special leave petition, wants the tribunal award allotting 3.9tmc ft to Karnataka for drinking quashed.

Title: AXIS 2020 set to showcase arms, models
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Nagpur: AXIS 2020, the annual technical festival of Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology (VNIT) to be held from February 28 to March 1, will witness a variety of exhibits of arms, ammunition, models of aircraft, aeroplanes, ships and submarines.

Vinita Paunikar, vice-president of Oracle America will be one of the speakers at the inaugural evening along with other experts under Innovision Series and The Industry 4.0 Summit.

Students of VNIT will hold exhibitions, guest lectures, events and workshops to impart technical expertise and provide a national platform to attract and nurture talent in the field of science and technology.

This year, exhibits include arms and ammunition used by the Indian Army, models of aircraft and aeroplanes piloted by Indian Air Force, and models of ships and submarines operated by the Indian Navy.

An ISRO space exhibition, in association with NRSC and INDRO 3.0, an autonomous humanoid robot designed for real-time human-computer interaction, will also be on display. There will also be exhibits by Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (Barc), defence hardware and equipment by Ordnance Factory, RC aircraft by DREAM Innovators, and one based on virtual and augmented reality by GlobalLogic.

Title: Cops bust two fake call centres in Jaipur, 23 held for duping foreigners
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

JAIPUR: Police raided two fake call centres here on Monday and arrested 23 employees for duping people in the US, China and Hong Kong on the pretext of giving them loans.

Police arrested 16 people from the call centre at Shyam Nagar, while seven were held from the hub operating out of Shipra Path. All the accused are well educated, police said.

Vimal Singh Nehra, additional DCP (Jaipur South) said, “We got to know that fake call centres, targeting foreigners, are operating in the city. We began surveillance and after confirming the activities, raided two places and arrested the accused.”

Explaining the modus operandi of the gang in Shyam Nagar, Nehra said: “The accused would gather contact details of Americans using websites like Yellow Page directories. They would then either generate voice calls or email their victims saying their loans have been approved or that they can apply for loans. They would explain the American loan process to their unwary targets and, once a person bought into this, the accused asked them to give a security deposit.”

The accused, however, did not accept cash or cheque. “They asked their victims to buy gift cards from various online shopping sites and then ask them to scratch the number printed on the back of the card. Following th0is, they would sell this number either virtually, or in person, in return for bitcoins. They would then get the bitcoins encashed in places like Ahmedabad,” Nehra said.

The Shipra Path gang adopted a variant model, though the common factor was that they also duped people in the name of loan sanction.

“In this case, the accused got the foreign citizens' data online. They called them giving the same story about loans as the other gang. They made a fake link of a real American finance company and ask the person to give a security deposit of $200 to $500 into that account. Once they got the person’s account details, they sold it to others in exchange for commission. The buyers of this gang were usually based in China and Hong Kong,” Nehra said.

Police are also looking out for other such call centres operating in Jaipur and are questioning the accused for information on this score.

Title: Delhi: Plea in SC for ensuring safety of anti-CAA protesters
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Supreme Court

NEW DELHI: Alleging that people are being provoked to attack those holding ‘peaceful’ protests against CAA, former Chief Information Commissioner Wajahat Habibullah and Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad on Tuesday moved the Supreme Court for protection of protesters and sought that an FIR be lodged against those responsible for violence in northeast Delhi.

A day before a bench of Justices S K Kaul and K M Joseph is scheduled to hear plea on removal of protesters from Shaheen Bagh, they pleaded the court that their application be also heard along with other petitions. Agreeing with their plea, the court listed the application for Wednesday.

Referring to the violent incidents in northeast Delhi in which nine people including a head constable were killed, they contended that antisocial elements from nearby villages of Uttar Pradesh had entered Delhi in buses and trucks and were attacking the residents and “peaceful” protesters.

They also said BJP functionary Kapil Mishra had made provocative statements as reported in the media and alleged that he was responsible for inciting and orchestrating the attack. They said police refused to register FIR against the attackers.

“Open threats are now being given to the protesters at Shaheen Bagh that they will meet the same fate as that meted out to peaceful women protesters at Jafrabad, Chandbagh etc. It is therefore imperative that appropriate orders are passed to put a stop to this violence on peaceful protesters and that the guilty are brought to book,” the petition said.

The apex court will examine on Wednesday a report filed by senior advocates Sanjay Hegde and Sadhana Ramachandran who were asked by the court to talk to protesters at Shaheen Bagh to persuade them to shift the site of the agitation. They filed the report after holding talks with the protesters.

Title: Giving dropouts one more chance to education
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Hyderabad: Nineteen-year-old Yadamma is engaged to an autorickshaw driver. But despite opposition from home, she is determined to complete her Class X before tying the knot.

Yadamma is one among 20 students, mostly school dropouts, living in a slum near the Miyapur Metro station, who study in a one-room school run by Chottu Ki Education (CKE), a NGO that has been working here for four years now.

When TOI visited the place, it found students — aged from eight to 19 — sitting on mats and loudly reading out Hindi alphabets from the blackboard. Parents of most children are either beggars or do odd jobs.

Founded by Yuvaneshwari K, CKE provides a one-year bridge course to dropouts, and helps them join school again. A scientist with a Hyderabad-based generic pharma company, 33-year-old Yuvaneshwari started the NGO after moving here from Chennai in 2016. Initially, she started teaching child beggars near KPHB Metro station on weekends, along with colleagues and friends. Eventually, with the help of a charitable organisation, she managed to get those children into residential schools. Thus, was born the desire to help more child beggars join mainstream.

“Our first hurdle was convincing parents to let their children study and not beg — that meant a dent in their income. The second challenge was to develop a basic curriculum, which would suit a mixed group. We also had to ensure that when admitted to schools, the students they stayed there and did not return to their old ways,” she said.

So far, CKE has worked with 55 children, of which 28 are now enrolled in mainstream schools. Her team includes about 50 people, including those who provide funds, clothes, guidance on how to help the children, and draw up the curriculum, etc.

“I dropped out in Class VI,” said 15-year-old Raju. “I used to collect garbage for money. But now I enjoy studying here. I love photography and Akka (Yuva) has said if I complete my education she will enrol me in a multimedia course.”

Yuvaneshwari’s efforts have given these children and teenagers a chance to dream of a secure future. “After learning to sew and embroider here, I stitch my own clothes,” Yadamma beams.

Title: Shreyas thrash BHS (ONGC) to lift trophy
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Vadodara: Rajveer Jadhav played a captain’s unbeaten knock of 125 runs to help Shreyas High School thrash Baroda High School (BHS), ONGC by 220 runs in the finals of Maharani Shantadevi U-19 Inter-School Tournament here on Tuesday.

Shreyas won the toss and chose to bat first at F B Colony Ground. Openers gave a flying start to Shreyas by gathering 58 runs in 51 balls. Spinner Harsh Dave brought BHS back into the game by claiming two quick wickets but their joy was short-lived.

Jadhav and Devdas Patre came together to stitch a partnership of 156 runs in just 111 balls for the fourth wicket. The duo literally toyed around with BHS bowlers and hit boundaries as well as sixes regularly. Devdas smashed 20 runs in the 32nd over of Krish Prajapati, to reach his 50 in 31 balls. While Rajveer reached his 50 in the 35th over.

BHS bowler Krish Prajapati, leading wicket taker of the tourney, finally broke the record stand, as Devdas was trapped in front of the wicket on 88, with 240 runs on board in 40 overs.

But Rajveer continued with his onslaught by scoring a century in 48th over of the game. Shreyas mounted a mammoth total of 337 runs for BHS boys who displayed poor fielding.

BHS seemed to be under pressure from the word go by losing their first wicket with just one run on board in the second over. Their batsman played too cautiously and scored a mere 21 runs in 19 overs.

BHS skipper Harsh Dave and Jenil Shah tried to salvage their team’s image by putting together 67 runs for the seventh wicket, but it was too little too late. BHS was bundled out for a paltry 117 runs as Shreyas boys erupted in celebrations. Shreyas spinner Hrushikesh ended up with a five-wicket haul.

Rajveer was awarded the man of the match for his unbeaten knock of 125.

Title: 50 Goans onboard quarantined cruiseliner to return to India today
Content:
A crew member wearing a face mask walks on the deck of the Diamond Princess cruise ship at Daikoku pier cruise... Read More

Crew will be quarantined in New Delhi

MARGAO: Chinchinim resident Dhanasth Raikar is looking forward to finally coming home. He is among the 50 Goans onboard the luxury cruiseliner Diamond Princess that has been quarantined off the coast of Japan since February 3.Raikar told TOI on Tuesday that though they have been informed about the arrangements being made by the Indian government to bring them back to India, no details have been shared with the 138-member Indian crew yet.“We have only been told to get ready to board the flight back to India on Wednesday. After over 500 Filipinos among the crew went back to their country in two chartered flights on Tuesday, only the Indian crew is left on the ship,” he said.Although two more Indians have tested positive for Coronavirus , Raikar said that all Goans aboard the vessel are safe and healthy. He added that the few Indians who have been affected by the virus have already been hospitalised and quarantined.The Indian embassy in Japan on Tuesday announced that the government of India has arranged a chartered flight to bring back all Indian crew members. “A chartered flight is being arranged to repatriate Indian nationals onboard #DiamondPrincess, provided they have (a)consented; (b)not tested positive for #COVID19;(c) cleared by the medical team. An email advisory to this effect, with details, has been sent to them,” read a tweet by the embassy of India in Japan.Spokesperson of the Goan Seamen Association of India (GSAI) Dixon Vaz told TOI that the hiring agent from Mumbai, Milind Kurturkar, conveyed to him that the flight carrying Indian crew members was likely to arrive in New Delhi by Wednesday.“Here all the crew members will be quarantined for 14 days and given treatment. Once they are cleared by the medical team, they will be able to return to their respective states,” Vaz said.In an earlier tweet by the Indian mission in Japan on Tuesday, it was informed that two more Indians have tested positive for the virus. “PCR test results for ALL Indian nationals declared-02 more Indians tested positive to #COVID19, taking the total to 16. Those fulfilling conditions and consenting to repatriation to India on 26 Feb being facilitated by the Indian Government,” the tweet read.All the affected Indians are responding well to the treatment, it said. “The shipping company has promised to pay two months extra salary to all crew members,” Vaz said.

Title: Businessman injured in chain-snatching bid
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Two unidentified robbers snatched a gold chain worth Rs2 lakh from a 30-year-old textile weaving unit owner here on Monday. When the victim began to chase the robbers on his bike, they took out a knife before kicking his motorcycle which resulted in his losing control and collapsing on a road. The businessman suffered multiple injuries on his face and hands. He received 14 stitches on face as his lips had got ruptured.

Ravi Patel, a resident of Althan , was returning home from his weaving unit on his motorcycle. He was about to enter Sterling Avenue at around 9.15pm when the robbers riding a motorcycle came close and sped away after snatching 60 gram gold chain that he was wearing.

"They snatched the chain in just one attempt and started escaping. Ravi immediately started chasing the robbers on his motorcycle. He chased the robbers for over one kilometre. When they reached a desolate road near Gandhi Kutir turn, the robbers took out a knife," said Amrat Patel, father of Ravi.

"Ravi was about to nab the robbers when they showed him the knife and one of them also kicked his motorcycle," said Amrat. Ravi, who fell on the road and suffered multiple injuries, got himself treated at a private hospital.

Title: Vadodara: Approval sought for 14 new roads
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

The road contracts were put on hold in wake of the row and cleared only later

VADODARA: The Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) is set to take up a series of road works in the city amounting to Rs 56.8crore. Work on 14 new projects have been put up before the standing committee.

The civic body had not taken up any new road works since the last couple of months as a major row had been raked up regarding awarding of road contracts. The issue was raised in letters by the opposition Congress party that also raked it up in the general board.

It was alleged that even state highways that saw heavy vehicle movement had a 45mm surfacing, but the VMC was insisting on 65mm surfacing on roads. The condition for contractors to have a hot mix plant within 30km of the periphery of the city was also questioned by the opposition alleging that this eliminated competition and only a select few bid for road works. The opposition also alleged that contractors who bid below the schedule of rates (SOR) for highways or in rural areas, bid 18% over SOR in VMC.

The road contracts were put on hold in wake of the row and cleared only later. As many as 14 works including those of new roads as well as those of road widening have now been taken up by the civic body. The contractors have been identified and works will be allotted once the standing committee gives a nod.

A source said that the civic body had eventually decided to go with a 65mm carpeting for a better life of the roads. VMC had also inquired with other corporations in the city and was informed that even they were making roads with similar carpeting.

VMC is also in a hurry to take up the works at the earliest as it wants to finish them before monsoon. Officials said that roads that were laid before summer had better a better life due to the heat in summer.

Title: Rajasthan: Sirohi Dalit schoolboy thrashed
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image.

JODHPUR: A TikTok video showing a Dalit schoolboy in Sirohi being pinned against a wall and repeatedly beaten with a stick by another student in the presence of other boys in school uniform has led police to file an FIR under the SC and ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

This is the third instance in less than two weeks of alleged attacks on Dalits coming to light through videos circulating on social media.

The latest incident was reported to Barloot police station in Sirohi after the TikTok video went viral on Monday.

Station house officer Manish Soni said on Tuesday that the attack possibly took place outside a school in Jhadoli Veer village and the victim was a Dalit boy. "We immediately registered a case, but we have yet to identify the culprits and ascertain the reason for the assault ," Soni said.

In another case, this one involving four stone quarry workers being stripped, tied and beaten up on Friday night, Jodhpur rural police on Tuesday arrested five men for assault and robbery. SP (rural) Rahul Barhat said the accused snatched Rs 68,000 from the workers, all of them Muslims, after assaulting them through the night.

A Muslim youth suspected of stealing a mobile phone had been allegedly stripped, thrashed and sodomised with an iron rod in Barmer district around three weeks ago. While the victim didn't tell anyone about it, his brother filed an FIR last Thursday after a video of the assault surfaced on social media.

On February 16, two Dalit youths were brutally assaulted by a group of men in Nagaur after being accused of stealing money from a motorbike servicing centre.
