Title: Kolhapur: Religious preacher stabbed, manhunt on for suspect
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: An unidentified woman attacked a 48-year-old religious preacher with a sharp weapon on Monday night.

The preacher identified as Jagannath Akaram Hirve and a resident of New Shahupuri, Kolhapur is admitted to the ICU of a private hospital. Police suspect personal rivalry and property issues may be the reason behind the attack.

According to Shahupuri police station, Hirve works as a secretary of the Church Council, Kolhapur and looks after the management of the assets and properties related to the Church. On Monday, he had gone to Islampur to inspect the church work there and returned Kolhapur at around 8 pm. He stopped his car near a church in the Nagala park area as he waited for one of the employees to get some documents from the office.

Suddenly a woman walking from the side of the road approached him and stabbed him in the throat. Hirve immediately raised an alarm as his colleague rushed for his help. The woman disappeared in the dark as Hirve bleeded profusely. He was immediately rushed to the Chhatrapati Pramila Raje (CPR) civil hospital for treatment but was later admitted to a private hospital where he is recuperating in the ICU.

The police said that the hospital authorities have kept him under observation. “We are gathering information about the incident and trying to find out the reason behind the attack. We have launched a search operation for the woman and will soon reach her. We are looking if Hirve had any personal rivalry or had quarrelled with anyone recently. The chances of a dispute over the property cannot be ruled out. We are exploring all the angles related to the incident and are investigating the case to find out the suspect,” said a police officer.

Title: Meerut: Addict kills wife, infant
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative Image

MEERUT: A 22-year-old drug addict, Monu Singh, allegedly strangled to death his wife Nisha, (20) and eight-month-old son on Tuesday morning after the couple quarreled over his addition.

The murders took place at Zahidpur village. The couple had a love marriage just 18 months ago with both going against the wishes of their respective families.

Avenash Pandey, SP (rural) said, “The couple often fought. Many a time. family members and neighbours had to intervene to bring peace between them. Preliminary investigation reveals that on Tuesday morning, the couple had another showdown, and Monu, apparently in a fit of rage, allegedly strangled his wife to death and killed their eight-month-old son. He has been arrested.”

Title: Pipeline repair: Ward A to not receive water on Wednesday
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) will undertake the leakage repair work on a major pipeline at Aptenagar pumping station passing along Phulewadi Ring Road on Wednesday owing to which ward A of the city will not receive water for a day.

According to a civic official, the supply will resume on Thursday but at low pressure. The pipeline pumps water into elevated tank located at Aptenagar from where the water is supplied to Phulewadi, Saneguruji Vasahat, Rajopadhyenagar, Kanerkar Nagar, Krantisinha Nana Patil Nagar, Tuljabhavani Colony, Cursher Chowk, Devkar Panand, nearby suburbs and rural fringe areas.

Ramdas Gaikwad, deputy hydraulic engineer of KMC, said, “Water loss is taking place through the main pipeline and elevated tank is not getting filled to its adequate capacity. Citizens are reporting inadequate water supply and at low pressure. Hence, we expect to complete the work on Wednesday, but it may take few more hours for tests and filling up the tank. Supply to affected areas will resume from Thursday afternoon onwards.”

He added that water tankers will be deployed to cater to the demand of the colonies and housing societies. “The pipeline passing along Phulewadi ring road has several leakages — both minor and major. The pipeline passes beneath the road and it is hard to find out actual spot of the leakage. The A ward requires 25 million litre of water every day, but owing to the leakages and other transmission losses, the actual supply is around 17 MLD,” the official said.

“After the leakage is repaired, we will check the amount of water being supplied to the A ward. Based on the outcome, we will take schedule will further repair work,” he added.

Title: 14-year-old girl abducted, drugged, raped in Muzaffarnagar
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative Image

Title: RTO action against 2 dealers for selling bikes without registration
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The regional transport office (RTO) took action against two motorcycle dealers in the city for violating rules.

According to RTO officials, the dealers were selling motorcycles without registering the vehicles with the RTO. Also, the dealers sold the vehicles without helmets. According to Supreme Court, it is mandatory for dealers to provide two helmets to the customers along with new motorcycles.

Taking action against the dealers, the RTO suspended their trade certificates.

S T Alwaris, RTO, Kolhapur division, said, “In one case, the dealer had submitted an affidavit of a motorcycle buyer to the RTO in which the customer had mentioned that he already possessed two helmets which he use while riding the new motorcycle. When we enquired with the motorcycle owner, he told us that he has not submitted any affidavit and that there was discrepancy in his signature on the affidavit. We, therefore, sent a notice to the concerned dealer and suspended his trade certificate.”

“In another incident, we received a complaint from a vehicle owner stating that the dealer gave him all the documents after purchasing the vehicle, but failed to register it with the RTO. Based on this, we checked all the documents submitted by the complainant and found that the dealer had not applied for the said vehicle’s registration . This was in violation with our rule and, therefore, we suspended the concerned dealer’s trade certificate,” he said.

Alwaris said that as per the directives of Supreme Court, it is mandatory for any motorcycle dealer to provide two helmets to the customer while selling the vehicle. “We have issued instructions to the dealers from time to time to follow these norms and had warned them of action if they fail to abide by the rules,” he said.

“We have already initiated action against two traders and are checking documents to verify that other dealers are following all rules. We will intensify our drive against such defaulters,” he added.

Title: Lucknow: No funky water guns, gulal bombs this Holi
Content:
Not just the Holi market, the toy and electronics industries are facing a crunch situation too owing to strict... Read More

LUCKNOW: Revellers hoping to buy Chinese water guns for Holi may be in for acute disappointment. Most city markets are left with limited stock of fun accessories for the festival, courtesy the novel coronavirus (nCoV) outbreak that has its epicentre in Wuhan, China.Not just the Holi market, the toy and electronics industries are facing a crunch situation too owing to strict curbs on imports from China, as Covid-19 (the disease caused by the virus) has claimed more than 2,000 lives in that country.Pawan Manocha, the president of Lucknow Traders’ Association, warned that shortage of new products was expected to push up prices of existing stock by 30-40% compared to 2019. “Every year, the Chinese market remains shut for a month on the account of New Year’s celebrations. The last time wholesalers in Lucknow stocked up on Chinese items was perhaps January 15. Now, because of the virus, we don’t expect stocks to arrive for at least three months,” Manocha explained.Retail shopkeepers maintain that Chinese water guns, gulal bombs and similar Holi paraphernalia are far cheaper and hence, more popular than Indian items. “In the absence of fresh stocks, most of us will have to sell last year’s leftover items,” said Naseer Ahmad, a shopkeeper in Aminabad.Owners of gadget stores are also feeling the pinch. Smartphone accessories, memory cards, LEDs, AC compressors and washing machine motors all are imported from China.

Title: Maharashtra: Auction notice issued to owner regularly paying property tax
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: The functioning of Mangalwari zone’s assistant municipal commissioner Harish Raut has once again come under scanner. This time, for issuing auction notice to a property owner who has been regularly paying property tax for an open plot in Zingabai Takli .

Senior Shiv Sena corporator Kishore Kumeriya said that apart from the affected resident, Vasantrao Gotmare, he too has submitted a written complaint to municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe and demanded an inquiry into the matter.

Gotmare, who stays in east Nagpur, owns a 216 sq m plot in front of Mankapur police station in Zingabai Takli. “Since purchase of the plot, I have never defaulted on property tax,” claimed 80-year-old and retired ZP official Gotmare.

For the current fiscal, Gotmare paid the property tax on May 30, 2019 itself and despite this, on December 12, the Mangalwari zone’s assistant municipal commissioner Harish Raut through an advertisement published Gotmare’s name along with other property owners’ names to auction their properties for defaulting NMC’s property tax. The advertisement shows that Gotmare has defaulted tax to the tune of Rs1.47 lakh. The advertisement also had some errors in Gotmare’s address.

Actually, it was not for the first time that the zone had carried out blunder. In November 2017 Raut did the same mistake.

Raut was not available for comments, while deputy municipal commissioner Mahesh Moroney assured to look into the matter.

Title: Sushil Modi budget in Bihar: Surplus but no new schemes
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Bihar deputy CM and finance minister Sushil Kumar Modi on way to present the state budget 2020-21 at Bihar Ass... Read More

PATNA: Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi presented a revenue-surplus state budget of Rs 2,11,761 crore for the 2020-21 fiscal in the assembly with a fiscal deficit of Rs 20,374 crore. It was the last budget of the Nitish Kumar government’s 2015-20 term ahead of the assembly elections to be held later this year.

With no new schemes announced, the budget estimate for the 2020-21 fiscal is Rs 11,260.48 crore more than the previous budget that was slightly over Rs 2 lakh crore. While revenue surplus worth Rs 19,172.80 crore is 2.80% of the estimated gross state domestic product (GSDP) at Rs 6,85,797 crore for the 2020-21 fiscal, the fiscal deficit is 2.97% of the same.

In an interaction later, Modi clarified that no new schemes were announced as a lot of ambitious schemes such as the five-year Jal Jeevan Hariyali campaign worth Rs 24,500 crore had already come into force since October last year, apart from the Rs 10 lakh loan scheme with the provision of subsidy payment to those among the extremely backward castes (EBCs) who wanted to start business or trade activity.

“The Jal Jeevan Hariyali campaign is the first of its kind in the country. For another first, the state government would table the budget on environmental conservation called Green Budget next month, along with the separate gender and child budgets,” Modi said.

Otherwise, of the Rs 2.11 lakh crore worth of proposed budgeted expenditure during the 2020-21 fiscal, Rs 1,05,766.35 crore is for the scheme (or plan) expenditure, and the remaining Rs 1,05,995.14 crore for the non-plan expenditure to be spent on meeting the establishment costs, salary, pension, interest payment and repayment of public debt.

The budget envisages total receipts of Rs 2,11,961 crore, with Rs 1.83,923 crore coming as revenue receipts, and another chunk of capital receipts worth Rs 28,037.50 crore. The revenue receipts incorporate receipts from the Centre by way of state’s share in the divisible pool of central taxes to the tune of Rs 91,180.60 crore and grants-in-aid worth Rs 52,754.10 crore.

To add to the revenue receipts, Rs 39,989.28 crore would come from the state’s own tax revenue worth Rs 34,750 crore and the non-tax revenue of Rs 5,239.28 crore coming from Jharkhand against pension share liabilities, mines, interest receipts, irrigation and other non-taxes. For capital receipts, the government would raise Rs 27,609.27 crore through borrowings and another chunk of Rs 428.23 crore would come by way of recoveries of loans.

The capital expenditure is Rs 47,010.30 crore -- that is, Rs 1,739.94 crore more than Rs 45,270.36 crore pertaining to the 2019-20 financial year.

Modi said on the recommendations of the 15th Finance Commission, the state’s share is 10.061% of the divisible pool of central taxes. While the estimate regarding the state’s receipt from the central pool of taxes fell to Rs 63,406.33 crore due to fall in the Centre’s tax receipts during 2019-20, the estimate of the state’s receipt from the same pool is Rs 91,180 crore during 2020-21.

Modi also said Bihar has suffered for abiding by the norms of Fiscal Responsibility and Business management (FRBM) Act, by which the fiscal deficit is kept at 3% of the GSDP. In contrast, the 15th Finance Commission has recommended payment of Rs 74,340 crore to the nine states as revenue deficit grant.

Title: NRC, CAA part of BJP’s vote bank politics: CPM
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Belagavi: NRC and CAA is a conspiracy hatched by the BJP to get Hindu votes, said CPM general secretary Sitaram Yechury here on Tuesday.

He said the CPM will conduct door to door campaigns across the nation from March 1 to 23.

“We oppose the NRC and CAA as they are harmful to our Constitution. He said the citizenship law will continue to face opposition. Other Left-wing parties too will participate in the awareness campaign against NRC and CAA,” he said.

He said that they will tell people to answer questions on census bit not those rewlated to NRC and CAA.

NRC and CAA is a threat to Dalits,and Adivasis, he claimed.

He held the Centre responsible for the violence that has erupted in Delhi over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and appealed to all to maintain peace.

Yechury said US President Donald Trump's visit will not benefit India, but is aimed at boosting the American economy.

He has come to boost his economy and not ours. So I do not see any benefit to our country.. The US President is coming to draw concessions for US farmers,” he added.

Title: HC stays interview for agri officers
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Jaipur: Rajasthan High Court on Tuesday stayed the interview for 39 posts of assistant agriculture research officers and 130 posts of assistant agriculture officers as the Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC) did not announce the cut-off percentage before proceeding with the interview.

The single bench of Justice S P Sharma, while staying the interview, also issued notice to the RPSC secretary on a petition by Jitendra Singh Bamboriya.

Sushila Kalvania, counsel for the petitioner, said the petitioner who is an OBC was not called for interview despite having much higher marks than the general category. The petitioner said after the written test, the RPSC declared the results and shortlisted candidates. But neither category-wise candidates have been shortlisted nor cut-off marks were announced before the RPSC going ahead with the interview.

Title: Hubballi: Coronavirus scare hits chicken sales; sellers blame social media
Content:
Hubballi has more than 15 dealers who own poultry farms and nearly 300 chicken shops in the city alone

HUBBALLI: Fearmongering on social media about spread of coronavirus from chickens had led to a 60% drop in sales and nearly halved prices, sellers said, while poultry farmers don’t know what to do with the piling stock.“A video about the spread of coronavirus from chicken went viral on Whatsapp and sales which used to peak in the weekends has dropped for a month now,” said Faizal Khan, who owns a shop in Keshwapur. “Many are believing rumours that chicken is the main reason for spread of COVID-19 . Nobody wants to take a chance.”Fake photos and videos are being circulated online, erroneously claiming that the virus passes from chickens to humans. The government stepped in to quell the rumours and clarify that chicken was safe for consumption but to no avail.Hubballi has more than 15 dealers who own poultry farms and nearly 300 chicken shops in the city alone. During winter, a kilo of chicken sold for Rs 220 while it has fallen to Rs 150-180 now. In the wholesale market, chicken prices have halved – from Rs 80-90 per kilo to Rs 45-60.“We are trying to convince people but those who used to buy a kilo are buying half a kilo at best. All sellers are reporting about a 60% fall in sales,” said Asif Khatib of AS Poultry.“I used to buy more than 3kg of chicken on Sundays but now, family members are scared of the coronavirus outbreak and reluctant to eat chicken,” said Rayan D'Souza, a businessman in Keshwapur.“Although prices will fall with demand, farmers cannot keep the bird for more than 40 days. They cannot keep feeding the birds and it will become a huge burden. Farmers are selling, even at a loss, to prevent the stock from piling up,” said Khatib.Sellers recalled that they faced a similar crisis during the H1N1 more than a decade ago but it’s worse this time due to the fearmongering on social media. “H1N1 pushed poultry into trouble. Thousands of birds were culled due to fear but eventually things returned to normal. This time, the fear is more widespread,” said a seller.

Title: Govt ‘no’ to pubs, micro-breweries
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The government has cleared the excise policy for the upcoming financial year, taking a cautious approach without giving any room for criticism. The policy does not have any new announcements including micro-breweries or pubs , that have been the demands from the tourism and IT sectors.

Instead, the government focused on minor increase of licence fees for the bar hotels, clubs and distilleries, that will only fetch a meagre Rs 5 crore additionally to the state exchequer. The existing fee for bar hotel licence (FL-3 licence) has been increased from Rs 28 lakh to Rs 30 lakh, while the liquor licence fee for clubs (FL-4) has been raised from Rs 15 lakh to Rs 20 lakh. The licence fee for bar in the airport lounge (FL-7) has been increased from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 2 lakh.

For distilleries and warehouses, the government has decided to double the fee in various categories, that will together fetch Rs 5 lakh additionally per distillery and warehouse. It has also been decided in the new excise policy to charge Rs 2 lakh from each of those distilleries from outside the state that have tie-ups with those within the state to manufacture liquor. The comptroller and auditor general (CAG) had pointed out that the government is losing revenue from such distilleries from outside the state that are manufacturing their products here.

In the toddy sector, the new excise policy has decided that the toddy shops will continue to function and sell toddy for three years or till the toddy board comes into force. The government has decided to set up toddy board in the state and it has been the long pending demand from the sector. The excise policy also decided to fix the quantity of toddy tapped from a coconut tree at two litres per day, which at present is only 1.5 litres per day.

The excise policy has also decided to legalize selling food in toddy shops and also not to make applicable the minimum distance factor for the toddy shops, unlike in the case of IMFL selling shops. However, the excise policy has not made any changes for the licence fee for beer and wine parlours (FL-9) which is now Rs 4 lakh. There are 595 bar hotels and 42 clubs in the state at present.

The government has not considered the long pending demand from IT and tourism sectors that the state needs to provide pubs and micro-breweries as part of improving its social infrastructure. The government has also not considered the proposal for allowing serving liquor in boutique restaurants, especially in major tourism centres. Since the assembly elections in the state will be held next year, the excise policy is expected to be the last one of the current LDF government.

Title: ‘One-third of Indian tourists to Singapore are from UP’
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Lucknow: Nearly a third of the total 1.42 million tourists from India who visited Singapore in 2019 were from Uttar Pradesh.

The remarkable figure was revealed by the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) on Tuesday during a mini-roadshow to apprise travel agents in UP of different packages it can offer and ways to promote the country to people who have already travelled there once.

As a part of STB’s initiatives to boost its tourism revenue in secondary cities of India, STB area director (India) Raymond Lim said the tourism board was also planning to hold commercial events in UP to promote Singapore and expose the country to people of this state in terms of food and high-street fashion.

“UP has a lot of potential and we saw a decent demand of 28% in 2019 too,” Lim told TOI, stressing that there should be direct air connectivity between UP and Singapore.

India is currently the third largest country in terms of visitors to Singapore.

Title: UP: Ram Lalla idols to be shifted during Navaratra
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Ram temple trust member Mahant Dinendra Das told TOI that the dates for shifting of idols would be finalised a... Read More

LUCKNOW: The idols of Ram Lalla are set to be shifted to a fibre structure during Navaratra, which will begin on March 25 and conclude with Ram Navami on April 2. The final date on which the idols will be shifted is yet to be decided.

Ram temple trust member Mahant Dinendra Das told TOI that the dates for shifting of idols would be finalised at the meeting of Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra trust to be held shortly.

The idols of Ram Lalla were first placed during the intervening night of December 22-23, 1949. After 43 years, the idols were removed when the disputed structure was demolished and placed at a safe location for 24 hours before being put in the makeshift temple.

Now, 28 years later, the idols will again be shifted, though temporarily, from the makeshift structure in Ayodhya when construction of temple begins.

Title: Varuna Exp terminated after arrival at Lucknow
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Lucknow: Passengers were in for a shock on Tuesday when Varuna Express (24227) was terminated at Lucknow station hardly 30 minutes before its scheduled departure.

Passengers between Lucknow and Kanpur had already boarded the train when an announcement was made that the train has been cancelled. Passengers had to board other trains to reach Kanpur.

The return service (24228) from Kanpur was also cancelled. Varuna Express operates between Varanasi and Kanpur via Lucknow.

A railway official said track maintenance work was on between and Lucknow and Kanpur and some technical glitch might have led to cancellation.

Passengers complained that the train was cancelled for several days in a month.

Title: Nagpur tops in deaths on rail tracks, thefts
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

NAGPUR: Nagpur tops the chart in people getting killed while crossing the tracks and also in railway thefts . Trespassing across railway tracks is a punishable offence with a penalty or imprisonment up to 6 months and or fine up to Rs1,000 under Section 147 of the Indian Railways Act.

Information received under RTI Act by activist Abhay Kolarkar from Government Railway Police (GRP) reveals that in the last three years (2017-2019), 59 people died while crossing the tracks under its 126km jurisdiction. Besides, 2,770 cases of thefts were recorded during the same period.

Despite having less kilometrage area under it, Nagpur tops the chart in the region in both the offences in GRP jurisdiction of 1,640km spread across Gondia, Itwari, Nagpur, Wardha , Badnera, and Akola for which information was sought.

In the last three years, overall, 533 passengers met with railway accidental deaths in the above six areas under GRP, while 170 died while crossing the tracks. Besides, 8,086 cases of thefts were recorded in which the stolen material valued over Rs14.89 crore. Of this, valuables in possession of GRP has been valued at over Rs1.89 crore.

The information also reveals that 1,101 cases against all the offences are pending in the courts while 1,297 thieves were nabbed and 1,141 being jailed after prosecution.

Nagpur has been closely followed by Wardha where 47 people died while crossing the tracks in last three years. Its jurisdiction is spread in 363km.

The information also reveals that more number of theft cases have been reported from stations where inflow of passengers is more. After Nagpur, Akola with having its jurisdiction in 316km, has recorded 2,087 cases of thefts.

Kolarkar says even as number of theft cases are high in areas like Nagpur (2,770), Akola (2,087) and Badnera (1,413), the detection rate seems to be dismal. Number of criminals arrested in Nagpur was 301, followed by 203 in Akola and 167 in Badnera.

Title: After killing wife, doctor couriered her gold to lover in Karnataka
Content:
Dr Revanth

Harshitha (L), Dr Revanth (C), Kavitha (R)

BENGALURU: Rajarajeshwarinagar Nagar police investigatig the suicide of a 32-year-old homemaker found that her dentist-lover had couriered to her his wife’s ornaments after killing his spouse in their home in Kadur, Chikkamagaluru district, on February 17.Dr Revanth jumped before a moving train on Saturday afternoon after police closed in on him for murdering his wife, Kavitha. He allegedly spoke to Harshitha, his lover, before ending his life. Police suspect Harshitha knew of the murder plot and his suicide move.Harshitha (L), Dr Revanth (C), Kavitha (R)On Saturday night, hours after speaking to Dr Revanth, Harshitha hanged herself at her house in Javaregowda Nagar, Rajarajeshwarinagar. On Tuesday, RR Nagar police recovered the gold ornaments from her house.Harshitha, who hailed from Tumakuru, was married to Sudarshan, a KSRTC bus driver-cum-conductor.“Around 4.30pm on February 17, Dr Revanth killed his wife Kavitha by injecting her with a sedative and later slit her throat. He took her ornaments weighing 115 grams, including the ones she was wearing, and packed them. He went to a courier shop in Birur and sent them to Harshitha, who received the parcel the next day,” an investigating officer said.Dr Revanth wanted the scene (Kavitha’s death) to look like it was murder for gain to divert police investigation, the officer added.

Title: Kerala CM hails Mannam’s contributions on reformer’s 50th death anniversary
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan (File Photo)

KOTTAYAM: On the 50th death anniversary of Mannathu Padmanabhan , the founder of Nair Service Society ( NSS ), chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan , on Tuesday, showered praise on him through a Facebook post.

Vijayan and G Sukumaran Nair, the current NSS chief, were at loggerheads during the Sabarimala women entry issue where Vijayan had slammed the NSS indirectly for standing against renaissance while Nair said that Mannam was the person who was instrumental in bringing renaissance to state.

In the post, Vijayan said the social reforms brought by Mannam have contributed to the formation of the present-day Kerala . The efforts by the NSS under the leadership of Mannam to resist the evil customs based on Manusmrithi is a glorious chapter in the history of Travancore.

Mannam inspired the community members to end bad customs like ‘Pula’, ‘Kettu kalyanam’, ‘Thirandukali’, etc. He led the Nairs to demand temple entry for all castes and to put an end to untouchability. Vijayan also acknowledged the role played by Mannam in the Vaikom and Guruvayur satygraha which were movements against untouchability and caste discrimination in the Hindu society of Kerala. He also acknowledged the lead role taken by Mannam in leading a march by the upper caste men from Vaikom to Thiruvananthapuram asking to allow lower caste people to use the roads on the premises of the Vaikom temple.

Meanwhile, the death anniversary was observed at NSS headquarters at Perunna on Tuesday. Hundreds of delegates from the different Karayogam units across the state queued up at the Mannam Samadhi here to offer floral tributes.

Title: Rajasthan: Vehicle with cops overturns in Nahargarh
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

The vehicle at Nahargarh on Tuesday. No one was seriously injured.

JAIPUR: A major tragedy was averted when a vehicle carrying 20 police personnel overturned in Nahargarh . No one sustained any major injuries.

The incident happened on the road between Nahargarh and Jaigarh around 11am on Tuesday.

The vehicle developed some kind of technical glitch because of which it overturned. There were 18 police personnel sitting in the back one of the trucks while two were in the front including the driver. Around half-a-dozen personnel suffered minor injuries who were taken to the trauma centre.

According to officials no one is in a critical state and police are investigating what led to the vehicle flipping over.

Title: Protest meet by civil rights groups at Indira Park
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Hyderabad: To protest the arrest of 15 persons, who are accused by Telangana police of having links with Communist Party of India (Maoists), and crackdown on several civil rights organisation, a meeting is being organised by various civil rights organisations on Tuesday under the banner Forum Against Repression (FAR) at Indira Park. Professor G Haragopal is the convener of FAR.

FAR members said that leaders from some of the opposition parties in Telangana will also attend the protest meet. The city police has granted permission to FAR members by imposing 19 conditions. “At the meeting, the family members of arrested persons will speak about their ordeal,” FAR members said. TNN

Title: Meerut MP gets bail in 8 years old case
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative Image

MEERUT: A special court here on Tuesday granted bail to Meerut MP Rajender Agarwal in connection with a case lodged against him eight years ago for allegedly halting a train during a protest over a separate bench of high court in western UP. The BJP MP also got bail in another case-- that of poll code violation-- from the same court.

After coming out of the court, Agarwal said, “I had participated in an agitation in 2012 because of which a train was stopped for around 20 minutes. The case is going on and the court had issued summons for my personal appearance. I got the bail now.”

Sirajuddin Alvi, additional district government counsel (ADGC), said, “Both the cases pertain to 2012. The one that concerns with stopping of train was filed by Railway Police Force of Meerut and the second one was in relation to violation of Model Code of Conduct in which the current MP had given speech without permission.”

This comes days after the court kept into custody BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP Vijay Pal Tomar and former SP MP Tabassum Hasan for five hours before granting them bail in a 13 year old case of violation of poll code.

The court appears to be getting strict in cases in which senior politicians have not appeared in the court for years. On January 29, SP MLA from Meerut Rafiq Ansari was also served non-bailable warrant in a 13-year-old assault case.

Title: UDF pushing alliance with communal forces: Kerala CM
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan (File Photo)

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday that UDF has stooped to a low level to accommodate all kinds of communal terrorist ideologies .

Referring to the ‘Occupy Raj Bhavan’ protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) that began on Tuesday, Vijayan said senior UDF leaders had addressed the Jama’at-e-Islami-sponsored protest.

“UDF had direct and indirect alliance with RSS . Now, they are associating with Jama’at-e-Islami and SDPI”, the CM said, while inaugurating the workshop organised for CPM local leaders as part of preparations for local body polls.

Vijayan said efforts are on to mobilize a grand alliance of right-wing forces against the LDF. “The forces which are champions of anti-Left ideals are at the forefront of that alliance. There is a peculiar situation in the state now where the Left-wing extremists and right-wing extremists are joining hands and they oppose the LDF together,” he told over 450 CPM local leaders representing different district committees, area committees and local committees in the state.

The CM said only a secular alliance can defeat the communal agenda propagated by the RSS. “We can’t take on one form of communalism with another one. SDPI and Jama’ath-e-Islami won’t be part of the secular fight against RSS. They need to be kept out of the joint protest by believers and secularists. We should also note that majority of people in Kerala are secular,” he said.

The CM also analyzed the functioning of local bodies in the state.

“There are serious criticisms against the local bodies. The criticisms are mainly about the negative approach of the local bodies. There is no justification for this. The common approach seems to be to put hurdles on all files,” he said. According to Vijayan, unhealthy practices like nokkukooli still exist in some parts of the state and that needs to be addressed.

CPM state secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan and other senior CPM leaders addressed the daylong session.

Title: Jaipur: Owners of 1,200 heritage buildings to get notice for altering facade
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Buildings wear different shades of pink at Chaura Rasta.

JAIPUR: The government will issue notices to owners of around 1,200 heritage buildings in Walled City for allegedly altering the facade of the structures. The buildings were identified during a survey by drones which came to an end recently.

Since the Walled City has been included in the UNESCO world heritage list, the government has been given the task to restore it in its original form to keep the tag.

The survey which started in October 2019 has a 3D mapping of the Walled City.

Jaipur chief town planner RK Vijayvargiya said that with the completion of drone survey they will start sending the notices.

“Owners have installed aluminium windows, AC duct and painted different shades of pink colour which are violations of building norms. Along with the notices, we will provide the owners alternate solution to rectify the violation. We have divided the alteration of facade into three categories like minor, moderate and severe. Notices will be sent on that basis,” said Vijayvargiya.

To supervise the heritage issues, a ‘heritage cell’ will be constituted in Jaipur that will send the notices. Two experts and a government official will be member of this cell. The members have already been identified.

Sources in the department, however, said that it is not possible for the government to send notices right before the urban body elections in Jaipur. “Elections will be held in April. So it will not be possible for the government to lay hands on their vote banks. So, any action will be taken after the elections are over or will take at least four months,” said a source.

Meanwhile, town planning department has decided to conduct another drone survey for the areas adjacent to the Walled City that also have heritage structures. “Drone survey of areas like MI Road, Amber, Moti Doongri, Ghat ki Ghooni and many other will start soon. These are buffer zones outside the walled city where heritage structures are established,” said Vijayvargiya. The drone survey is a part of the Heritage Management Plan which will be a composite document of traffic, sewage, parking, encroachment. At present drone survey is done for the buildings situated on the main road. To preserve buildings situated inside, another plan is functioning.

Title: UDF pushing alliance with communal forces: Kerala CM
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan (File Photo)

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday that UDF has stooped to a low level to accommodate all kinds of communal terrorist ideologies .

Referring to the ‘Occupy Raj Bhavan’ protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) that began on Tuesday, Vijayan said senior UDF leaders had addressed the Jama’at-e-Islami-sponsored protest.

“UDF had direct and indirect alliance with RSS . Now, they are associating with Jama’at-e-Islami and SDPI”, the CM said, while inaugurating the workshop organised for CPM local leaders as part of preparations for local body polls.

Vijayan said efforts are on to mobilize a grand alliance of right-wing forces against the LDF. “The forces which are champions of anti-Left ideals are at the forefront of that alliance. There is a peculiar situation in the state now where the Left-wing extremists and right-wing extremists are joining hands and they oppose the LDF together,” he told over 450 CPM local leaders representing different district committees, area committees and local committees in the state.

The CM said only a secular alliance can defeat the communal agenda propagated by the RSS. “We can’t take on one form of communalism with another one. SDPI and Jama’ath-e-Islami won’t be part of the secular fight against RSS. They need to be kept out of the joint protest by believers and secularists. We should also note that majority of people in Kerala are secular,” he said.

The CM also analyzed the functioning of local bodies in the state.

“There are serious criticisms against the local bodies. The criticisms are mainly about the negative approach of the local bodies. There is no justification for this. The common approach seems to be to put hurdles on all files,” he said. According to Vijayan, unhealthy practices like nokkukooli still exist in some parts of the state and that needs to be addressed.

CPM state secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan and other senior CPM leaders addressed the daylong session.

Title: Maintain status quo on green belts: NGT to Smart City body
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Central bench of National Green Tribunal (NGT) on Tuesday ordered Bhopal Smart City Corporation Ltd to maintain status quo in terms of green belt in the smart city coming up in Bhopal — which involves cutting of more than 6,000 trees in Tatya Tope Nagar.

In a petition, an NGO Green & Green, contended that Bhopal Smart City Corporation Limited was not leaving community open spaces in the smart city, which are developed in green belts, a mandatory provision in the National Forest Policy -1988.

Counsel for the petitioner, Sachin Verma, told NGT judges that in the Environment Impact Assessment Report submitted by the Bhopal Smart City Corporation, TT Nagar Stadium and T T Nagar Dussehra ground have been shown as “green belt” areas and argued that there could not be any plantation in a stadium or a Dussehra maidan, then how does Smart City Corporation Ltd proposes to develop them as green belt areas.

Referring to the apex court judgements in a number of cases, he said that the Supreme Court has described community open spaces as “lungs of the society” necessary for people in residential areas to breath clean air.

He said that 1,500 trees have already been felled in the areas under Smart City project and another 45,000 would be felled as the project progresses but due to lack of open spaces, compensatory afforestation is not happening in the area.

Verma referred to media reports that the compensatory afforestation against the trees felled in the areas under Smart City would take place in Kaliasot area and asked whether people from Smart City would go to Kaliasot for breathing clean air.

Following preliminary arguments on the issue, the central bench of NGT ordered Smart City Corporation Limited to maintain status quo in the area under its jurisdiction in terms of green belts. When asked what does the tribunal’s interim order signify, Verma said “There can be different interpretations of the order but for me, the NGT has directed for stopping of all construction activities in the Smart City areas”.

“We have yet to receive details of the NGT case. All environmental norms would be complied with,” said BSCDCL official after the NGT order. There are seven smart city projects underway including development of commercial space along TT Nagar stadium and they could be impacted as a result of the case. Smart city development area is predominantly residential in nature with 46% residential share, 11% mixed use development, about 7% commercial, 6.5% educational, 11% open Space/ Parks/ Sports and 2% utilities.

Title: Rise in TB cases among youngsters in slums
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Hyderabad: Healthcare professionals working in slum areas in and around the city said that increasing number of youngsters, aged between 17 and 25 years, are being diagnosed with pulmonary and extra pulmonary tuberculosis . They also said that there are more number of cases among girls than boys.

Mujtaba Hasan Askari, founder of helping hand foundation, said, “A quick survey by our foundations has revealed that many girls do not eat proper breakfast and are always rushing to reach schools and colleges. We also found that they are not even having proper lunch. Most of these students have more of junk and processed food, which lowers their immunity and increases the risk of contracting TB. Poor nutrition, malnutrition and poverty are synonymous with TB.” TNN

Title: No Pakistan link in KAS question paper, says KPSC chairman Sakeer
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

KPSC chierman MK Sakeer

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Dismissing the allegations raised by senior Congress leader P T Thomas that Kerala Public Service Commission (PSC) plagiarized Pakistan’s 2001 civil service exams while setting questions for Kerala administrative service ( KAS ) preliminary exams held recently, as a substandard allegation, PSC chairman M K Sakeer said it was deliberate attempt to discredit PSC.

“PSC’s procedures while conducting recruitment tests are foolproof, including those for KAS. Such allegations are part of a false campaign against an examination which received accolades from all quarters for its conduct and standard of questions,” Sakeer said on Tuesday. The questions in question were theory-based under subject of public administration, which could figure in similar tests in the world, he pointed out.

In a Facebook post, Thomas alleged that questions 63, 64, 66, 67, 69 and 70 were copied from Pakistan’s 2001 civil service exam, and urged the government to conduct a comprehensive inquiry. “This is serious lapse on the part of the state government and PSC. Action should be initiated against the guilty,” he said. Asserting that KAS preliminary exams maintained a high standard as it was required for an efficient shortlisting from over three lakh candidates, the PSC chairman said the final exams too will maintain a similar standard and will have quality questions.

Sakeer also said that PSC’s directive to block the profile of registered candidates who fail to appear for the exams (which means they will not be able to apply for the recruitment tests to follow) had its desired result of bringing down such tendencies among candidates.

On the PSC’s demand to the government and police to initiate action against coaching centres which misuse the name of the commission, Sakeer said advertising as PSC coaching centre can mislead the public to believe that these centres are either run by PSC or affiliated to it.

Title: Gomtinagar Extension murder: Main accused surrenders
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: The alleged mastermind of last Thursday’s fatal attack on a 20-year-old engineering dropout in Gomtinagar Extension surrendered in Lakhimpur Kheri district court on Tuesday. Arpan Shukla (25), the son of a kanungo (court clerk), was later taken into police custody.

Lucknow police commissioner Sujeet Pandey told TOI that they would seek Shukla’s transit remand. “He was on the run since the murder and was forced to surrender following police pressure. We will take him into remand to recover the murder weapon,” Pandey said. A case against him was pending in Kheri.

Last Thursday afternoon, victim Prashant Singh was stabbed at least 10 times at Gate 1 of Alaknanda Apartment in posh Gomtinagar area in front of guards. He bled to death. An FIR was lodged against Shukla and his aides. DCP (East) Somen Barma had announced a reward of Rs 15,000 on Shukla.

Police investigations revealed that Prashant and his friends had had a clash with Shukla and his group at a Barabanki restaurant last Wednesday night. The brawl triggered the attack.

Based on CCTV camera footage from the restaurant and the apartment complex, police identified Aman Bahadur, Abhishek Pandey, Vimal Singh, Abdul Ghani Khan, Tarun Singh and Anjani Yadav as accomplices.

Three of them — son of a former BSP MLA Aman, astrologer’s son Abhishek and Tarun whose father is a businessman — are already in police net.
