Title: Dip in GST cess mop-up to hit states hard: Mitra
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kolkata: West Bengal finance and industries minister Amit Mitra who also was the head of the empowered committee of state finance ministers for GST rollout was worried about the slow growth of GST cess collection in the last few months. This would leave the finances of the states in serious jeopardy, feels Mitra.

The Bengal FM was deeply concerned that whether the Centre can pay GST compensation to states following the massive fall in growth of GST cess collection. While speaking at a conference on ‘West Bengal, Poised to Lead, Business & Beyond’ organised by CII, Mitra indicated that the growth of cess collection has gone down to just 1.5% from targeted 21%.

Describing the current situation as grim, Mitra explained that GST cess was meant for giving the compensation to the states as was decided by GST Council during the rollout of the new indirect tax regime. Taking 2015-16 as the base year, the states are supposed to get a compensation if the growth of tax collection falls below 14% level on year-on-year basis.

However, the Bengal finance minister feels that as GST cess has failed to achieve targeted growth figure, and the Centre cannot pay the compensations either. “My concern is whether at all we shall get the GST compensations for February and March,” he added.

West Bengal has not received the compensation for January either. “The finances of all the states would be in deep trouble if the Centre does not pay the compensation. Several states as far as we know have resorted to overdraft and ‘ways and means’ funds to meet the commitment,” he added.

Mitra also criticised centre for increasing various cess and surcharges which are not part of state devolution. “In last 2-3 years, we have observed that cess and surcharge has gone up many fold. Centre should have done this by raising taxes and duties then states would have got the benefit but here only centre is getting the money,” he added.

The Bengal FM explained that besides GST cess, there was an increase in cess and surcharge on customs duty, excise duty as well, which are not part of GST compensation formula either. Mitra came down heavily on GST network as well as overall financial corruption by added that there has been 14 times increase in suspicious transactions from 62,000 to 14.36 lakh in the last few years. There has been Rs 46,000-crore penal interest as well as in GST, which was not recovered. “There has been a sharp increase in cost of compliance as well post GST,” he added.

Later, commenting on West Bengal growth story, Mitra claimed that as per revised estimate of the Centre, West Bengal has achieved a GSDP growth of 10.4% in the current fiscal, which is double that of the country’s GDP of 5%.

Last year, too, the state had achieved a 12.5% growth compared to 6-6.5% nationally.

Title: Properties of absconders Azam Khan and kin to be attached
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

(File photo of Samajwadi party MP Azam Khan)

RAMPUR: A day after rejecting anticipatory bail pleas of Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan , wife Tanzeen Fatimah and son Abdullah Azam, who are both MLAs, and declaring them “absconders”, a local court on Tuesday ordered “confiscation of their moveable and immovable properties” in connection with a forgery case. The accused have been chargesheeted under various sections of IPC for allegedly helping their son obtain two fake birth certificates.

In a separate case related to an alleged encroachment over enemy property by Azam Khan, additional district and sessions judge Dhirendra Kumar Kamboj had granted anticipatory bail to Azam on Monday but ordered him to surrender his passport to police and seek court’s prior permission before embarking on a foreign trip.

In September 2019, the court had issued summons to all three lawmakers, after taking cognisance of the chargesheet filed by Rampur police, in which all three have been charged with forgery and cheating. The court had directed the SHO of Ganj Kotwali police station, under whose jurisdiction the family resides, to ensure compliance of its order.

Thereafter, the court had issued non-bailable warrants against the Khans after they had failed to present themselves before it.

After the prosecution claimed that the accused were clandestinely shifting valuables from their house, on the directions of the court, police carried out an inquiry and found the charges to be true.

Following this, the court invoked section 82 of CrPC to proclaim them “absconders”. The court directed the police to comply with the proclamation notice against Azam Khan and others into the matter.

The accused have been chargesheeted under sections 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 467 (forgery of valuable security, will), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating) and 471 (using as genuine a forged document) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

On January 3, 2019, local BJP leader Akash Saxena had lodged a complaint alleging that Azam and his wife helped their son in obtaining two fake birth certificates – one from Lucknow and another from Rampur – following which an FIR was registered at Ganj Kotwali.

Additional district government counsel Ram Avtar Saini said, “The court rejected the anticipatory bail applications of Azam Khan, his wife and son in three separate cases related to Abdullah's date of birth certificates, PAN cards and passport.”

Title: Central Railway plans second class in AC local to woo riders
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Fully AC coach local train at Churchgate railway station

MUMBAI: In a sign of things to come, the Central Railway has proposed having two classes in AC trains-first and second-and tweaking the fare structure to draw passengers towards the air-conditioned service.

The proposal comes against the backdrop of poor response to its first AC local introduced on the transharbour corridor last month. CR runs only 12 AC services a day. These services have caused lot of resentment as they were introduced by replacing non-AC trains. Subsequently, CR has not introduced any more AC trains though it has three AC rakes and the fourth is on its way to its carshed -rolling out AC services means removing non-AC ones due to lack of path.

CR's principal chief operating manager DK Singh has written to the railway board member (traffic) to make a case for rationalisation of fare structure. In a letter dated February 17, Singh wrote, "The patronisation of AC rakes is not encouraging. The reasons are excessive fare compared to second class non-AC travel, skeleton AC services being run on certain identified routes, thus depriving complete migration from non-AC to AC."

Singh also submitted a detailed note to justify the proposal. "Fare of AC EMU is 1.3 to 2.6 times that of first class fare. 10% of the total suburban travel is first class and 90% by second class. For 90% of second class passengers, the difference in fare between second class fare and AC class is prohibitive. Thus migration to AC is not forthcoming."

Singh suggested that existing AC rakes be modified with earmarked first class and second classes. "With this combination, migration of second class passengers can be made possible... Second AC fare will be higher than non-AC but lower than existing first class non-AC or present AC class. This reasonable increase will be acceptable to passengers as compensation to better AC and risk-free environment of safe travel. First class will be provided with cushioned seats, mobile charging points."

Regarding the fare, he suggested that Delhi Metro fare structures with a minimum of Rs 10 and maximum of Rs 60 be made applicable for second class AC . For first class AC, he suggested the present fare structure be retained. He also suggested the second AC fare be increased gradually as more rakes are introduced.

Title: Delhi violence: 30 booked for holding protest at Marine Drive
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Candlelight protest in Marine Drive against Monday night Delhi violence

MUMBAI: The Marine Drive police on Tuesday filed a case of unlawful assembly against a group of at least 30 people for gathering at Marine Drive. The group carried out a candlelight protest against the Monday night violence in Delhi.

A few of the people in the group gave speeches against the violence that took place in some parts of Delhi on Monday. Those supporting the CAA and NRC clashed with the protesters. Stones were pelted, properties were set ablaze, and bullets were fired in Delhi, and 13 people, including a policeman, were killed.

No arrest has been made yet. The only notified area for protest in Mumbai is Azad Maidan. "We have registered a case and are probing it further," said zonal DCP S Nishandaar. "We have booked them for conducting protest without permission and assembling unalwfully," said a senior officer.

On several occasions in the past, police detained protestors and let them go after taking their details. Recently, police said they should be aware about who is gathering to protest to avoid confusion or untoward incidents.

Title: Sheena Bora Case: Sheena Bora was alive after 'murder', says Indrani Mukerjea
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Indrani Mukerjea

MUMBAI: During arguments on her fifth bail plea, Sheena Bora murder accused Indrani Mukerjea told the special CBI court on Tuesday that the victim was alive six months after her alleged murder on April 24, 2012 and was with her fiance Rahul Mukerjea . Citing Rahul's call data records, Indrani pointed to a text message exchange allegedly between him and Sheena from September 2012.

"The evidence that they have relied upon to charge me with the murder of Sheena establishes that she was alive and with Rahul on September 26, 27 and 28, 2012," Indrani said. She read out the alleged messages from September 27, 2012. One from Rahul, she said, was: "Baba am in the car park. Come na."

Indrani said Sheena replied "5 mins, bubs" and then Rahultexted, "Eh chalo jaldi".

Indrani said, "This is happening six months after her alleged murder. This explains why none of the bodies (two sets of remains that CBI purported were Sheena's) match with Sheena's." Indrani pointed this out to contradict the CBI's claims that she was last seen with Sheena on the night she was murdered.

Indrani submitted that no one could say she had sent these messages to Rahul as she was in England at that time. "And also, it will be very odd if Rahul in the entire message is talking about coming there in ten minutes, sitting in the car park and then Indrani walks down (instead of Sheena). It is not possible," Indrani said. She said she had go through 4,000 messages before she found these.

Read this article in Bengali

Title: BMC seizes 2 choppers for unpaid property tax
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

One of the helicopters sealed by the BMC in Juhu on Tuesday to recover Rs 1.6 crore

MUMBAI: With just a little more than a month left for the BMC to meet its property collection target for the financial year, the municipal corporation on Tuesday cracked the whip on two tax defaulters. It disconnected the water supply of a commercial building in Kalina, the Wadhwa Trade Centre, and sealed two helicopters of Mesco airlines in Juhu .

An official said it was the first time that action by the BMC involved movable property as well.

Municipal officials said the Wadhwa property owed the BMC Rs 13.3 crore, of which only around Rs 2 crore was paid. The payment has been pending since 2013. "Water supply will be restored after the remaining amount is paid," a municipal official from the assessment and collection department said.

A Wadhwa Group spokesperson said it had challenged the property tax assessment, claiming that the amount owed was not more than Rs 6 crore. "Of this, half the amount is to be paid by the building society. We will clear our share within the next few weeks," the spokesperson said. He said the BMC levied its building property tax rate applicable in the Bandra-Kurla Complex when its building is in Kalina.

The BMC claimed it was still to issue bills to individual establishments in the building and that the unpaid amount ws for the entire structure that the owner had to pay.

In Juhu, the BMC sealed two helicopters of Mesco airlines to recover over Rs 1.6 crore for 2019-2020. "The company cannot move the helicopters as it was decided to seal them at the site," a municipal official said.

The BMC property tax collection target for the year is over Rs 5,000 crore and so far around Rs 3,152 crore has been collected.

Deputy municipal commissioner Ramesh Pawar said the BMC always follows the requisite process before taking harsh action.

"We first raise a demand notice, after which awareness is created by asking people to come and pay their taxes, and if the same is still not paid then water connection is disconnected, following which an attachment-cum-distress-warrant is issued and, lastly, the property is auctioned. This is the first time we are cracking down on movable properties as well. We have also decided to publish the names of the top 10 defaulters in the newspapers if they continue to evade paying taxes," Pawar said.

Title: Two passengers allotted same berth in Duronto Exp
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Nagpur: A woman with a confirmed train ticket booked three months ago had to suffer severe humiliation when her berth was allotted to a RAC passenger recently. She was also forced to pay Rs 1,150 penalty for travelling ‘without ticket’, and ended up sleeping on the floor.

The railways claimed the woman’s ticket would be ‘deemed cancelled’ if it was booked by an agent using an individual’s login ID. However, the woman’s return ticket booked using the same ID was not cancelled.

In a complaint to Central Railway’s Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) at Nagpur, R Sridevi claimed she booked e-ticket (PNR 8126631992) on November 2, 2019, for travel by 12290 Nagpur-CSMT Duronto Express to Mumbai on February 14, using her personal ID.

Sridevi had been allotted seat number 57 in S-7 coach. “When the train was nearing Wardha, during ticket checking, I showed my e-ticket to the TTE. But he told me the berth was in some other passenger’s name, and my name did not figure in the list of confirmed passengers,” she said.

“The TTE asked me to vacate the seat I had booked three months ago, and threatened to offload me at Bhusawal and hand me over to RPF. However, since travelling to Mumbai was urgent, I proceeded with the journey, for which TTE charged Rs 1,150 as excess fare ticket (EFT). The EFT was prepared near Wardha, but it mentioned Ajni. I had to sleep on the floor and went through severe mental stress,” Sridevi said.

She added, “In Duronto, there is flexi fare system. I paid Rs 530 while booking berth and the RAC passenger who was allotted my berth paid Rs 705. This indicates I was the first to book the berth. So, how was the berth given to another passenger? My ticket also clearly mentions it was booked on a personal ID.”

“A bonafide woman passenger travelling alone in the night was deprived of her right for no fault. The treatment I was meted out by the TTE was very shabby. From one single berth the railways collected Rs 2,385 (Rs 530 original fare, Rs 705 from RAC passenger, and Rs 1,150 as penalty) against normal fare of Rs 490,” she said.

In the same journey, two passengers travelling in AC-III compartment to CSMT also did not find their names in the chart and paid a penalty of over Rs 7,000.

Assistant commercial manager (ACM) & Central Railway spokesperson SG Rao said, “On February 11, RPF personnel had seized a bunch of 11 tickets from an unauthorized agent. These tickets were booked with the user ID from which Sridevi had booked her ticket. Such tickets are deemed to be cancelled, and hence passenger names don’t appear in the chart.”

Rao added, “RPF officials are investigating cases related to these seized tickets. Only after completion of probe can we confirm genuineness of Sridevi’s ticket.”

However, Sridevi argued, “How can two user IDs and passwords be the same? Also, if this was the case, why was my return ticket of February 16 from Mumbai, booked at the same time, not blocked?”

Title: PM Modi said he bats for religious freedom: Donald Trump
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

President Donald Trump addresses a news conference in New Delhi. (Picture credit: NYT)

NEW DELHI: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that he had brought up the issue of religious freedom in India with PM Narendra Modi . “We did talk about religious freedom. I will say that the PM was incredible and he told me that he wants people to have religious freedom. He told me that in India they have worked very hard to have great and open religious freedom,” he said.

Asked about alleged discrimination against Muslims and rise in hate crimes against them under Modi, the president said, “Well, we discussed that and specifically Muslims and we also discussed Christians, I had a very powerful answer from the PM. We talked about religious liberty for a long period of time in front of a lot of people and I had a very, very powerful answer. And the PM said we have 200 million Muslims in India and a fairly short while ago they had 14 million and he said they have been working very closely with the community.”

Trump’s disinclination to speak on CAA must come as a relief for the government, which had billed the visit as a big leap in India-US ties aimed at cementing and advancing a crucial strategic partnership spanning antiterrorism cooperation to trade and commerce.

On another tricky terrain, that of Kashmir , Trump repeated his favourite formulation that he could help or mediate and referred to there being “two sides to every story” but did so without any particular vehemence.

“We talked a lot about Pakistan. I have very good relations with PM Imran Khan . We talked about it at length actually. No question that it’s a problem. But it’s a problem they have been working on. India is a brave nation and I have said I will do whatever I can do because my relations with both gentlemen (Modi and Khan) is so good. But there have been difficulties in Pakistan and we are seeing what we can do about it. Anything I can do to mediate, anything I can do to help, I will do,” Trump said.

He emphasised the convergence between the two nations as well as between him and Modi on terrorism. “We discussed terrorism and I think we have some very good ideas. I feel very strongly against terrorism.PM Modi is a very religious man as you know, he is a very calm man but actually he is a very very strong person. Very tough actually, I have seen him in action and he has got that foremost in his mind — terrorism,” he said.

The tenor of Trump’s remarks reflected the Indian side’s view that India and the US are increasingly moving together on critical areas of national security, energy and technology with ties rebadged as a “comprehensive global strategic partnership” as the two leaders announced earlier in remarks to media.

The president’s remarks were punctuated with strong praise for Modi and an implicit acknowledgement that he found the PM’s response to issues of religious freedom in India and on terrorism sourced from Pakistan convincing.

In his briefing, foreign secretary Harsh Shringla said Trump didn’t specifically bring up CAA. “You would have heard President Trump in his speech yesterday in Ahmedabad referring to religious diversity and harmony that is evident in India; discussions really to the extent possible were on these lines on this issue,” he said. “The issue of CAA did not come up; there was appreciation from both sides that pluralism and diversity are a common binding factor of both countries,” he said.

Title: Accountability should be hallmark of Spandana: CM
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Vijayawada: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy on Tuesday said that the distribution of house-site pattas for the poor on March 25 will make it a red-letter day in the history of Andhra Pradesh.

Reviewing the progress of Spandana programme here on Tuesday, the CM said accountability should be the hallmark of the programme while receiving grievances from people and clearing them in a week.

He said alerts are a must to make the programme a success.

All collectors were advised to take the help of the officials if need be and complete land acquisition, marking of plots by March 1. The marked plots should be developed at the earliest and beneficiaries decided on the basis of a lottery and the collectors should be liberal in allocation of plots, the CM said. He added that there should be a thorough supervision of requisitions from people for plots from ward and village secretariats.

The CM directed the officials to ensure the completion of the house-to-house survey and mapping at the earliest by volunteers at ward and village secretariats as it would enable them to deliver the schemes at the door-steps easily. He said maintaining attendance register for the staff at the secretariats should be made mandatory.

DGP Gowtham Sawang informed the CM that an early verdict in the rape-and-murder case in Chittoor was possible with the immediate charge-sheet filed by police and providing concrete evidence in the court. The CM congratulated Chittoor SP Senthil on the occasion. He directed chief secretary to take immediate action to set up special courts.

With reference to complaints of power cuts from Srikakulam, Vizianagaram and East Godavari districts and water problem in Krishna, West Godavari and Kurnool districts the CM directed the officials to take immediate action on the issues.

Title: RS elections: YSRC set to boost seat strength to six
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Vijayawada: The four vacant seats from the state to Rajya Sabha are likely to go in favour of YSRC once the elections take place by the first week of April.

On Tuesday, the Commission issued the notification for Rajya Sabha elections to be held on March 26. YSRC already have two RS members.

The term of Rajya Sabha members K Kesava Rao (TRS), M A Khan and T Subbarami Reddy (Congress) and Thota Sitarama Lakshmi (TDP) will get over on April 9.

TDP lost three MPs--Y S Chowdary, T G Venkatesh and C M Ramesh--to BJP earlier in 2019. With the retirement of Sitarama Lakshmi, TDP would have only one member in the Upper House from the state.

With the retirement of Khan and Subbarami Reddy, Congress would be without any members from the state in the Upper House of Parliament.

K V P Ramachandra Rao, who represents Telangana, too would retire on April 9.

With six members in Rajya Sabha, YSRC may get to play a bigger role as NDA does not have a majority in Rajya Sabha.

Title: Naidu questions CM Jagan’s absence from Trump dinner hosted by Prez
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Tirupati: TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday alleged that chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy was not invited to the dinner hosted by President Ramnath Kovind in honour of visiting US President Donald Trump in New Delhi “as the USA does not like dealing with leaders involved in cases”.

Naidu made the remarks at a press conference in his native Kuppam in Chittoor district. ‘‘US laws are very strict and generally the US government does not deal with anyone who is involved in criminal or economic offences of any kind. That’s why they didn’t entertain an economic offender like Jagan ,” alleged Naidu.

The YSRC reacted sharply to Naidu’s allegation. “Naidu is only degrading himself with such comments. The Union government invited only eight chief ministers for the dinner. Naidu is trying to link it with the disproportionate assets cases on Jagan for political gains. Naidu is the biggest financial offender in the country. He is facing allegations in the vote-for-note scam, ESI scam, insider trading in Amaravati lands and other cases. He should respect the mandate given by people before making such comments,” fumed Malladi Vishnu Vardhan, Vijayawada Central MLA, who is also the chairman of AP Brahmin Corporation.

Earlier, Naidu addressed rallies as part of his Praja Chaitanya Yatra at Kangundi, Govindapalli, Vijalapuram and Dandikuppam on the second day of his Kuppam tour. Flaying Jagan for “disillusioning the future of the state by adopting flawed policies”, Naidu said all good work done by his government has come to a standstill.

Title: YSRC leaders slam TDP’s Praja Chaitanya Yatra
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Vijayawada: Responding to the ongoing Praja Chaitanya Yatra, which has been undertaken by the TDP to sensitise people on the ‘failures’ of the YSRC government, several prominent YSRC leaders held press conferences across the state on Tuesday.

Across the state, they strongly advocated for decentralisation of development and rejected Chandrababu Naidu idea of concentrating development in one place. Referring to the Amaravati unrest, the YSRC leaders alleged that Naidu has been trying to damage the image of Andhra Pradesh by creating unrest through sponsored agitations. He is using the media to propagate a distorted and false versions of the incidents and engineering attacks on Nandigam Suresh, Vidathala Rajini and others as he is nervous about the SIT probing the irregularities in land pooling, they alleged.

In Kadapa, deputy chief minister Amzadh Basha reiterated that an all-round development can only take place through decentralisation and the government is committed to it.

“Naidu started Praja Chaitanya Yatra for his benefit and to protect his benamis. He will be sent to jail soon for the corruption during his regime” Basha said.

In Srikakulam Dharmana Prasada Rao, minister for roads and buildings, told the media that Amaravati is an example of Naidu’s business model. He was concentrating only on one region even after he lost Hyderabad.

“The difference between Jaganmohan Reddy and Naidu is very clear. While Naidu has given sops before the elections, Jaganmohan Reddy has launched numerous schemes during his first six months in office. While Naidu wanted to develop only one region and concentrate on one place, our leader wants to decentralise development,’’ he asserted.

Speaking on similar lines, MLA Kakani Govardhan Reddy in Nellore said Naidu was trying to create unrest in the state to send false signals. The concept of self-financing is nothing but real estate business and is aimed at only creating wealth to his coterie. MLA Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy accused Naidu of using the media to damaging AP’s brand image by spreading false rumours.

Chief advisor (public affairs), Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy while addressing the state trade union working committee in Tadepalli said decentralisation is the only option for a uniform development of all regions. “We have brought in village secretariats for the convenience of the people,” he said.

Title: Hindi theatre stages comeback in city, needs more promotion
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Nagpur: In an indication of the growing popularity of Hindi plays, the ongoing 51st Maharashtra State Hindi Theatre competition is drawing a decent response from city theatre aficionados. The audience has grown as the number of Hindi plays being staged has increased. However, a ‘houseful’ tag for a Hindi play still seems to be a distant dream.

Directors, writers and theatre artistes, all agree that Hindi theatre is finding its feet in Nagpur, where Marathi theatre is dominant. They feel, though, that Hindi theatre still lacks in good promotion skills.

Vaidehi Chawre, coordinator of the theatre fest, said that though the response is decent, the plays haven’t been able to garner a full house yet. She adds, “The ongoing Hindi theatre competition is not attracting expected audience. Maybe because of show slots. For instance, not everyone is OK with morning shows on weekdays.”

Salim Sheikh, a well-known writer and director, predominantly works in Marathi theatre but also dabbles in Hindi theatre, is happy to see the increase in number of good Hindi plays being staged in Nagpur. “I believe love and respect for Hindi theatre has increased in the city, and Vidarbha at large, since the last few years. There were times when hunting for a handful of good Hindi plays was a task. Yet, now there are plenty of well written plays,” he said.

Agreeing with Sheikh, Lalit Ghavghave, a theatre actor, believes that there are a select few good Hindi plays that are staged, maybe once a month or so. “Here, people's Hindi also carries an essence of Marathi. I believe there should be equal promotion of Hindi plays, so the beauty of quality theatre is enjoyed by audience in both language,” he said.

However, Virendra Ganvir, whose play was also staged in the theatre competition, feels that there is an equal set of audience for both Hindi and Marathi plays. “Number of people showing up for Hindi plays is less than the Marathi ones, but if any play carries a good story and acting, it will always outshine,” he said.

As for promoting Hindi theatre in the city, there are more factors at play than just the language. “Before planning any state-level Hindi competition, government must chose appropriate timings. Nobody will take leave to watch a play at 12 noon, during office hours,” added Salim Sheikh.

Writer-director Shital Dodke feels that choosing appropriate centres will also facilitate smooth staging of these plays, “Usually, the plays are held at different centres. Even though the audience has increased, are we attracting enough audience? It needs more promotion and appropriate season for such contests,” he said.

Title: BJP takes to streets, flays MVA government on various issues
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

The agitation was in full swing at six places in Nagpur and 13 locations in the district

NAGPUR: BJP workers on Tuesday upped their ante against the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government by kick-starting a statewide agitation to highlight various issues, including injustice to farmers, spanner in the wheels of developmental works and atrocities against women.

The agitation was in full swing at six places in Nagpur and 13 locations in the district. BJP leaders like Vijay Puranik, Mayor Sandip Joshi, ex-mayor Pravin Datke and ex-guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule slammed the Uddhav Thackarey-led MVA government. The murder of Ankita Pisudde in Hinganghat and the acid attack in Gondia were among the prominent issues raised.

Party MLAs Krishna Khopde , Mohan Mate, Vikas Kumbhare and ex-MLAs Dr Milind Mane, Sudhakar Kohale, Sudhakar Deshmukh, Sudhir Parwe and other leaders were present at different locations where demonstrators raised slogan against Thackeray’s decisions of stalling projects started by the BJP government under former CM Devendra Fadnavis.

Bawankule, who led the agitation in rural Nagpur, said at a press conference that the MVA coalition failed to keep its promise of compensation up to Rs 25,000 per hectare to farmers hit by untimely rains and another Rs 50,000 per hectare to owners of orchards due to crop failure. He pointed out that the BJP government had disbursed Rs 19,000 crore to 43 lakh account holders through ryot compensation schemes.

Bawankule also came down heavily on the government for reversing many decisions of the previous BJP-led government. He also said that it would a challenging task for the incumbent leaders of the MVA coalition to retain the allocated district planning funds.

Anusaya Gupta, women president of South-East Nagpur unit of BJP and also member of the state women’s commission, said there were demands for stringent laws against assaults on women. She was present at the agitation held at Chhatrapati chowk.

Title: NEXT is finally here, IMA holds workshop for MBBS graduates
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Nagpur: Forgetting their opposition to the proposed national exit test ( NEXT ) for MBBS graduates before they start their practice, the Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Tuesday organized a workshop for them about the test. Junior doctors’ network and medical students’ network — two important wings of the IMA — invited Dr Rajat Jain from New Delhi to do the task.

“IMA has objections about many provisions in the National Medical Commission (NMC) bill. Exist examination for MBBS graduates used to be one of them. But now the medical body has decided to go along with the exit test. First NEXT is scheduled to be held in 2022,” said Dr Jain, who is recognized as a great guide by medical students across the country.

As a student, Dr Jain had cracked PG-NEET entrance with Rank I and he is known for providing key insights to passing entrance tests with flying colours. The workshop organized by IMA Nagpur and witnessed jam-packed attendance of students.

“Students who started their MBBS in 2017 will appear for NEXT for the first time. The score in NEXT will also serve as their score in entrance examination for PG courses (PG-NEET). The format of NEXT is broader than existing PG-NEET and it will test their clinical knowledge thoroughly,” he said.

Dr Jain suggested MBBS students to start attending their classes seriously and understand the concepts. “Take your clinical postings very seriously and complete internship honestly. Try to gather as much of practical knowledge as you can as the pattern is drastically changing and you can expect a lot of weight given to such clinical oriented pattern of questions,” he added.

IMA Nagpur branch organized this workshop for the first time in the city. Former president of IMA Nagpur Dr Ashish Disawal, who is now national vice-chairman of IMA students’ activity wing, was the coordinator.

IMA Nagpur President Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala said the workshop was of great benefit for the MBBS students preparing for PG-NEET and to those who are waiting to fill admission forms for PG after clearing their PG-NEET. “Doctors received great guidance in this workshop about their preference filling process, and entire PG admission process,” he said.

Title: Maharashtra: Denied blanket, worker murders dhaba owner
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Enraged over denial of a blanket for sleeping at night, a dhaba worker allegedly killed the eatery owner in the early hours of Tuesday.

The deceased has been identified as Prakash Jaiswal, 53, owner of a dhaba at Wadamba village on Pauni-Navegaon road. The police have arrested accused Kara Bawan, who was allegedly left angry after Jaiswal had denied him a blanket after two guests had walked in at the dhaba for a night stay.

It’s learnt that Jaiswal was fast asleep when Bawan assaulted him with a stick on his head, face and neck.

Bawan, allegedly a short-tempered vagabond, was sheltered at the dabha by Jaiswal. Though Bawan was learnt to be working at the dhaba without any fixed salary, Jaiswal ensured that he got his meals and also a place to sleep apart from some pocket money on a daily basis.

According to sources, two persons from Madhya Pradesh Mahesh Iwnatey and Adharsingh Iwnatey , who worked till late at a brick-kiln in the vicinity and could not return home, had stayed at the dhaba for the night. While they and others were asleep, they woke up on hearing sudden commotion and witnessed Bawan hitting Jaiswal with a stick. They rushed to rescue Jaiswal but had to retreat as Bawan hit them also.

One of the guests fled the place and reached Deolapar police station, under Nagpur rural police, where Rameshwar Vithole, another worker at the dhaba, had also reached and narrated the incident.

The police rushed to the spot and found Jaiswal dead. They sent the body for post mortem and took Bawan into custody. Further investigations are on.

Title: Maharashtra government scraps cabinet rank posts for two leaders
Content:
Ravindra Waikar (L), Arvind Sawant

MUMBAI: In a reversal of a key decision it had taken recently, the Maha Vikas Aghadi government led by Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday scrapped the appointments of Shiv Sena MP Arvind Sawant and Sena MLA Ravindra Waikar to the posts of chairman of the Maharashtra state parliamentary coordination committee and chief coordinator in the Chief Minister’s Office respectively.The reversal came amid controversy that the appointments might get mired in an ‘office of profit’ row as both Waikar and Sawant had been given the rank of cabinet minister and would be entitled to a salary and perks. An elected representative cannot hold any other office of profit, so Waikar and Sawant could not really draw perks or salary as they are members of the state assembly and the Lok Sabha respectively, it was argued.The scrapping nullifies the Sena’s attempt to pacify the two senior party leaders (see graphic). The twin posts were in fact created in order to accommodate the two.According to a government resolution of February 20, the state has scrapped their appointments as they were not willing to take up the roles. TOI contacted Sawant and Waikar but both declined comment. Sources said BJP had decided to raise the issue, forcing the government to reverse its move to avoid embarrassment.Sena sources said a revised decision might be taken in Waikar’s case as there was not question of ‘office of profit’ in his case. “Waikar is an MLA, so there was no question of receiving a salary by the state. He is also ready to not avail of other benefits.”

Title: Khambhat News: Violence erupts in Khambhat, top cops shunted
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Fresh violence erupted on Tuesday after a public gathering was organized near Tower Bazaar

VADODARA: Fresh violence broke out in the coastal town of Khambhat in Gujarat’s Anand district on Tuesday as a mob set a house and a shop ablaze in Mochiwad area of the town. No injuries were reported.

The fresh round of violence broke out after a public gathering was organised by ‘Hindu Samaj’ near Tower Bazaar area in the heart of Khambhat town.

Following the rioting, state home department transferred Anand superintendent of police Makrand Chauhan and Khambhat’s deputy SP Reema Munshi. Three police inspectors were also shunted with immediate effect by the DGP’s office.

‘Hindu Samaj’ had called a bandh on Monday following which shops and businesses in all markets of the town remained closed. A large number of people, however, joined the public gathering.

“The gathering was not organised by a social or political organisation. Residents of Bhavsarwad area, where rioters had looted around 25 households apart from damaging vehicles, had appealed to people to come out in support of those affected in the rioting,” said former BJP MLA from Khambhat Sanjay Patel. Patel, along with Khambhat city unit head of the BJP, Pinakin Brahmbhatt, was among those who addressed the gathering at Tower Bazaar.

“The bandh was voluntary. It was successful as shops, whether owned by Muslims or Hindus, remained close during the day,” said Patel.

The town has been on the boil since Sunday following communal clash between members of minority and Chunara communities in Akbarpura area. As the violence, which began in Akbarpura, spread to other parts of the town, around 30 houses and shops were set ablaze and about a dozen vehicles were damaged by rioters.

The town again witnessed violence late on Monday evening when a police party raided Lal Darwaza area to arrest residents wanted for Sunday’s communal clash. Around 15 cops were injured after a mob attacked them. One of the constables fractured his hand.

Title: Guv presides over varsity convocation
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Barasat: Bengal governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday presided over the fourth convocation of West Bengal State University as chancellor, when he couldn’t do so at Calcutta University and Jadavpur University due to student protests. Dhankhar emphasised on fundamental duties and urged students to be tolerant of other points of view even if they disagree.

“As chancellor and governor, I am working to secure healthy practices. There is some positive headway. Friction between Raj Bhavan and government is stressful for universities. I am trying my best to neutralise it,” Dhankhar said. tnn

Title: We can't keep our eyes off this Sikh bride's beautiful pink Sabyasachi lehenga
Content: The wedding season is on and 2020 is showing us a lot of new trends in wedding decor and style. And, since it's the first installment of the new year, we are getting to see a lot of brides experimenting like never before. While all brides look beautiful, somehow only a few manage to grab the eyeballs and we came across one such pretty bride who is breaking the internet.We are talking up make-up artist Sonali Bajwa, who looked out of this world at her Sikh Wedding or Anand Karaj and you can't miss the pictures.Sonali donned a beautiful pink lehenga with elaborate gold thread work by none other than ace couturier Sabyasachi Mukherjee.The wedding, which was held in Chandigarh, had Sonali looking totally dreamy and we loved everything about her look.Sonali accessorised the look with a beautiful choker, a layered necklace, a maang tikka, matching jhumkas, choodas and kaleeras.The dapper groom Gurmukh Bajwa, looked suave in a patterned beige sherwani which he teamed up with a traditional pink turban, kalgi, maala and mojaris.We loved the duo's wedding avatar, tell us how did you like it in the comment section below.

Title: Parties crunch nos. with 5 RS vacancies in Bengal
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kolkata: Political parties are back in their war rooms strategizing the numbers game for the March 26 elections to five vacancies in Rajya Sabha (RS) from West Bengal.

BJP is far behind in the race because it doesn’t have adequate numbers. MLAs in the Bengal assembly are voters in RS polls.

As many as five members — Ritabrata Banerjee, K D Singh, Jogen Chowdhury, Manish Gupta and Hassan Ahmed — are retiring from the Upper House of Parliament on April 2. Going by the MLA count, ruling Trinamool is set to send four of its candidates to RS. Names of former Lok Sabha members Dinesh Trivedi and Mousam Noor are doing the rounds in Trinamool circles.

Speculation on several combinations such as Congress-Left, Congress-Trinamool is rife over the fifth candidate as RS elections involve proportional representation by means of single transferable vote.

The Bengal assembly now has 293 elected members following the demise of a member. The quota for getting elected for each candidate is thus 49 in terms of first preferential votes. Neither Congress nor Left has the numbers to win the fifth seat on its own. A section of Pradesh Congress and Left leaders thus prefer a common candidate.

The ground reality, however, is a little different. A host of Congress MLAs is allied with Trinamool. Now, if Trinamool fields the fifth candidate in consultation with Congress high command — as had happened earlier —chances are he/she may scrape through.

Some Left and Congress members want to prevent cross-voting by issuing party whips. They believe this will prevent vacillating MLAs from turning up to vote. Leader of the opposition Abdul Mannan left it to the Congress high command to take a call. “I will abide by the party’s decision,” he said.

Pradesh Congress chief Somen Mitra said: “I will have to initiate talks with them (Left) before we take a decision on the issue.”

Left legislature party leader Sujan Chakrabarty too prefers to wait for the CPM politburo meeting.

Title: 101 lifers freed in West Bengal since December after serving 14 years
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Calcutta high court

KOLKATA: As many as 101 lifers have been released from Bengal prisons over the last 86 days since December 2019, the largest number freed in such a short span of time, as part of a bold reformative-justice plan.

Twenty-seven prisoners , including two women, were released on Tuesday, a move that helped Bengal cross the three-figure mark. Seventy-five more are exp-ected to be released again soon. The spike follows the Calcutta High Court ’s fast-tracking of a Supreme Court-mandated process that makes a court nod essential for early release of people serving life sentences.

The state can commute sentences under Sections 432 and 433 of the Criminal Procedure Code. But it can commute life sentences only after a convict has served at least 14 years.

The home secretary-chaired State Sentence Review Board reviews cases and recommends to the government prisoners found suitable for early release.

One hundred and ninety-three prisoners were released in the three-year period between 2010 and 2012. But the process underwent a change after a November 2012 apex court judgement by Justices KS Radhakrishnan and justice Madan B Lokur, which said state governments must obtain a court’s nod before exercising this power for life convicts.

Early-release numbers dropped significantly following this between 2013 and 2018; only seven were released early in a three-year period between 2016 and 2018.

This prompted the Calcutta HC to step in and expedite pending appeals and hold regular meetings with the state government, a senior government official said. This paved the way for the State Sentence Review Board. Forty-six life convicts were released following this process in December 2019; 28 more were released this January and 27 on Tuesday.

“The board has, among others, the state director-general of police and the Kolkata Police commissioner. One of the parameters taken into account is a convict’s conduct in prison,” the official told TOI. But a state government can revoke an early-release order; the convict then must return to prison.

Title: BJP to finalise civic manifesto during Shah’s Kolkata visit
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kolkata: Bengal BJP is likely to draw up the party’s civic poll manifesto on March 1 when Union home minister Amit Shah comes to Kolkata for the Shahid Minar rally. Shah will meet “core committee” members after the rally to fine-tune BJP’s poll campaign.

While BJP supporters will be all ears for what Shah says on CAA and NRC following the violence in Delhi and the saffron party’s reverses in the Delhi assembly polls, political observers will watch out for former mayor Sovan Chatterjee. Chatterjee’s presence or absence in the rally will chart his role in the civic battle ahead, said BJP sources.

BJP leaders have set a tall target of mobilising supporters for Shah’s rally from Kolkata, Bidhannagar, Howrah, South 24 Parganas and North 24 Parganas, when the party doesn’t have a firm footing in the city, Howrah and South 24 Parganas.

“There is no denying that we are yet to make a mark in the city, though our support is increasing. We are concentrating on Kolkata, Howrah and South 24 Parganas for an impressive turnout at Shahid Minar,” said BJP state general secretary Sayantan Basu.

Bengal BJP’s position is just the reverse of TMC’s formative days when Mamata Banerjee’s party had a strong presence in the city and the suburbs in south Bengal. BJP, on the contrary, has begun its journey in Bengal by springing a surprise in the districts, particularly in north Bengal and Jangalmahal. BJP made an impressive show last December when party president J P Nadda visited Kolkata.

Title: This stunning ode to Odissi dance leaves Hyderabadis asking for more
Content: Almost 500 Odissi dancers from across the world performed in the city recently. Ravindra Bharathi resonated with the footsteps of the dancers as a number of troupes took the stage, one after the other, and showcased their craft with grace.The dance performance took place in front of a packed audience and went on for nearly three hours. Narrating tales from Indian mythology through their dance, the performers captivated the audience and kept them glued to their seats right through the evening. A felicitation ceremony for renowned dance gurus followed. Srinivas Goud, Minister for Tourism and Culture in Telangana and Mamidi Harikrishna, Director of Language and Culture Department, Government of Telangana, were among the distinguished guests at the event.

Title: This stunning ode to Odissi dance leaves Hyderabadis asking for more
Content: Almost 500 Odissi dancers from across the world performed in the city recently. Ravindra Bharathi resonated with the footsteps of the dancers as a number of troupes took the stage, one after the other, and showcased their craft with grace.The dance performance took place in front of a packed audience and went on for nearly three hours. Narrating tales from Indian mythology through their dance, the performers captivated the audience and kept them glued to their seats right through the evening. A felicitation ceremony for renowned dance gurus followed. Srinivas Goud, Minister for Tourism and Culture in Telangana and Mamidi Harikrishna, Director of Language and Culture Department, Government of Telangana, were among the distinguished guests at the event.

Title: Mamata: Delhi violence disturbing, restore peace
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

Kolkata: Chief minister Mamata Banerjee is “deeply disturbed” over the continuing communal violence in Delhi.

“Ours is a country where we need to stay together. I am deeply disturbed. I am deeply concerned. I do not know what is going on there. We, the people of India, want peace. I appeal to all please restore peace,” the CM said at Kolkata airport before leaving for Bhubaneswar on Tuesday evening.

Banerjee also took stock of the law and order situation in sensitive areas and asked Kolkata Police to beef up vigilance in the city and its suburbs.

The CM has gone to Bhubaneswar to attend the February 28 meeting of the Eastern Zonal Council, to be presided over by Union home minister Amit Shah. The council, like other zones, is placed under the Union home ministry to promote cooperative federalism between the Centre and states. The zonal councils take up border issues, inter-state transport, emerging social issues across states and also the status of linguistic minorities. Chief ministers are members of the council. Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik is the vice-chairman of EZC.

Banerjee left three days ahead of the meeting because of other preoccupations. According to Nabanna sources, she is set to offer prayers at Jagannath temple in Puri on Tuesday and visit the Lingaraj temple the next day.

In the meantime, the Bengal CM may have a meeting with Patnaik, who has already said no to NRC.

Kolkata hosted the EZC meeting in 2018 with then Union home minister Rajnath Singh as chairman. The CMs of Bengal and Jharkhand were present.

Title: At UNHRC, Pakistan demands release of all Jammu & Kashmir politicians
Content:
This story is from February 26, 2020

GENEVA: Pakistan on Tuesday raked up the Kashmir issue at the UNHRC in Geneva and demanded the immediate lifting of the communication restrictions and release of all the politicians and activists in the Valley, saying any ‘inaction’ by the international community will only ‘embolden’ India.

Speaking at the 43rd session of the Human Rights Council which is being held in Switzerland from February 24 to March 20, Pakistan’s minister for human rights Shireen Mazari alleged that India continued to violate the human rights of the Kashmiri people and demanded the immediate repeal of all actions by India on August 5 last year in Kashmir.

She appealed the Council to constitute an independent commission of inquiry to investigate and report the alleged human rights violations in Kashmir as proposed in a UN report.

Title: Bengaluru: First in 6 years, bus fares up 12%; BMTC spared
Content:
The fare revision will also affect passengers in rural areas as well as inter-city passengers

Fare hiked due to rising operational cost

KSRTC justifies move

BENGALURU: In a move that could impact lakhs of bus passengers, Karnataka government on Tuesday decided to increase fares by 12% effective Tuesday midnight — first hike in six years.In a relief to Bengalureans, the government spared Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation from fare revision. The revision is applicable to Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation, North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation and North Eastern Karnataka Road Transport Corporation.The notification was signed by M Sathyavathi, undersecretary to the government (transport department).The fare revision will also affect passengers in rural areas as well as inter-city passengers. The move will also force many inter-city passengers to shift to trains, private vehicles and rental cabs.The rising operational cost is citied as the reason for the hike. Fares of state transport undertakings haven’t been revised since 2014. However, STUs in Karnataka still have one of the highest fares in the country. All of them are incurring heavy losses due to skyrocketing operational costs.STUs are spending about 50% of their outlay on staff wages and 30% on fuel costs. Statistics show at Rs 349.4 crore, BMTC suffered maximum financial loss in 2018-19, followed by KSRTC (Rs 134.9 crore), NWKRTC (Rs 89 crore) and NEKRTC (Rs 68.2 crore). Many of them have trimmed schedules to reduce losses.In November, chief minister BS Yediyurappa said the government would reduce bus fares of STUs to encourage people to use public transport. However, the CM recently backtracked on the promise.While a hike of 18% was announced in September 2018, it was reversed by then CM HD Kumaraswamy in under 30 minutes due to public backlash. All four STUs are hoping for a significant allocation in the budget to stem losses.Activists slammed the move to revise fares. Srinivas Alavilli of Citizens for Bengaluru, an NGO, said: “The move will encourage people to travel in unsafe modes as well as private vehicles, including twowheelers. This will severely affect people in smaller towns and their right to commute for education or to find jobs. The bus fares should be reasonable and should not encourage more private vehicles and traffic congestion.” He said BMTC fares should be reduced by 50% to make it affordable.KSRTC claimed it has taken steps to reduce the burden on rural passengers. “There is no increase of fares on passes issued to students and differently abled persons,” said a release. “In ordinary services, fare of first 3km has been reduced from Rs 7 to Rs 5 and for has not been increased for the first12 and15km. In express services, fare for the first 6km is the same,” it said.It stated there is a steep rise in high-speed diesel rates in the international market.
